font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let me quote\nWikipedia:-- ( don\u2019t expect them to talk about the trinity and the Sanskrit mantras\n&nbsp;)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE:&nbsp; <i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Vesta is the goddess of the hearth of the\ncity of Rome.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Dum\u00e9zil[5] draws a\ncomparison between Roman religious conceptions and rituals and the relevant\naspects of Vedic religion. Sacrificial ritual in Vedic India, required the\npresence of three fires, two of them being essential.[6]<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The so-called\ng\u0101rapathya, hearth of the landlord marks the connection to the Earth of the\nofferer; it is the marker of the origin of the whole ritual act. In Vedic\nritual such kind of fire must be round as Earth itself was believed to be round\nand also because on Earth there is no distinction in direction without\nreference to Heaven.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The \u0101havan\u012bya,\nsacrificial fire, or fire of the offers on the contrary must be quadrangular as\nit is intended to convey the sacrificial offer to Heaven in the form of smoke.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">These two fires are\nlaid on a West-East line.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The third dak\u1e63inagni,\nfire of the right side has the function of protecting the offerers from attacks\nof evil spirits and is placed to the South, believed to be a dangerous\ndirection.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">In this conception the\nfunction of defensive fire was performed by the temple of the god Vulcanus that\nwas situated to the south of the pomerium, sacred city wall, this location\nbeing in accord with what could be expected from the homology with the Vedic\nsituation<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">It is noteworthy that\nthe sacred fire of Vesta, as standing for and representing the terrestrial\norigin of the community, could be lit only by the friction of two pieces of\nwood.&nbsp; Quite a number of rules of the\naedes Vestae we know about can be explained by the interpretation of the\nsignificance of homologous rules in Vedic rituals concerning the hearth of the\nlandlord.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">In the light of this\ntheology it is noteworthy that Vesta is always invoked the last in all ritual\nformulas concerning one or more gods (Vesta extrema), while Janus, the god of\nbeginnings and passages, associated with Heaven, is always invoked at the\nbeginning. This use is comparable to that concerning Agni in the Rig Veda: Agni\nis invoked first or last or at both places<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The correspondence of\nVesta with Vedic god Agni was noted long ago.[19] Dum\u00e9zil recalls that in the\nIndian epic poem Mahabharata the episodes of Karttikeya, god of war and son of\nAgni[20] and of Agni and the daughters of Nila[21]</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">UNQUOTE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Roman senators were mostly Hindu ( Pagan\n)&nbsp; .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Theodosius refused to restore the\nAltar of Victory in the Senate House, as requested by pagan Senators.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Altar of Victory was located in the Roman\nSenate House (the Curia) and bore a gold statue of the goddess Victory. The\naltar was removed from the curia by the Christian emperor Constantius II in\n357.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">It was later restored by the Pagan emperor Julian, who was the only\nemperor after the conversion of Constantine I to reject Christianity.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The altar\nwas again removed by Gratian in 382. Petitions to restore the statue were\ndeflected in 391 by an edict of the Christian emperor Theodosius I as part of\nhis efforts to ensure that Christianity was the only religion practiced in the\nEmpire.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">WELL WELL, TIME TO BREAK ANOTHER BOMBSHELL,\nWHICH WILL RAISE MY REVELATIONS TO 16.5%.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: x-large; line-height: 150%;\"><b>\n\n\n\n\n\n</b></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: x-large;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\">ALL ROMAN SENATORS WERE PAGAN .&nbsp;</span>&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">BUT FOR THE INTERNET AND THIS BLOGSITE, THE\nWORLD &nbsp;WOULD HAVE NEVER KNOW.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ALL THE MAGNIFICENT RUINS OF ROME ARE HINDU\nPAGAN<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE ST PETERs CATHEDRAL HAS A SHIVA LINGAM IN\nITS VAULTS.&nbsp; EVERY ANCIENT CATHEDRAL IN\nEUROPE HAS A SHIVA LINGAM IN ITS FOUNDATIONS.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"The ruin of Paganism, in the age of\nTheodosius, is perhaps the only example of the total extirpation of any ancient\nand popular religion; and may therefore deserve to be considered, as a singular\nevent in the history of the human mind.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gibbon,\nDecline and Fall of the Roman Empire (XXVIII)<o:p></o:p></span></b><br />\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 150%;\">Below: All Roman and Greek ruins are shorn off any vestige related to PAGANISM ! I have spent several days among these ruins. &nbsp;I was there in Acropolis , Parthenon for &nbsp;3 weeks.</span></b><br />\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 115%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/02/madain-saleh-destruction-of-ancient.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/02/madain-saleh-destruction-of-ancient.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-zSVxDVhPhlY/Vu5k_mMqh1I/AAAAAAABGXs/EhJl8RUo6zo-DYbrG6RlMvffJ0xJ5t5kA/s1600/paganFFism.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"426\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-zSVxDVhPhlY/Vu5k_mMqh1I/AAAAAAABGXs/EhJl8RUo6zo-DYbrG6RlMvffJ0xJ5t5kA/s640/paganFFism.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Emperor Gratian in AD 382, instigated by a\nMAD Christian priest named Ambrose, bishop of Milan, withdrew all funds , state\nsubsidies, and long standing revenues that maintained Pagan Hindusim.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The title of pontifex maximus, which had\nsignified authority over state religion, was snatched away.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In India Hindu\ntemples fell to ruin because the white invader snatched away the traditional\nHindu temple lands which grew Ayurvedic herbs for 6000 years.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/07/king-cobra-and-snake-temples-of-kerala.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/07/king-cobra-and-snake-temples-of-kerala.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But a deputation of pagan\n( Hindu ) senators led by the well respected Pagan Symmachus, the leading\norator of his day, was refused even an audience with the emperor.&nbsp; &nbsp;After\nGratian's death, there was another petition, and in AD 384 the question again\nwas put to his successor Valentinian II.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hearing of this attempt\nto restore the Altar, MAD Bishop Ambrose sent a letter to the young emperor,\nasking to see the petition and threatening censure and sacrilege if favorably\nreceived by Valentinian.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">\"Salvation will\nnot be assured unless each one truly worships the true God, that is, the God of\nthe Christians...Since you have truly shown your faith in God, most Christian\nEmperor, I am amazed that your zeal for the faith, and our protection and\ndevotion, have inspired hope in some that you are now obligated to erect altars\nto the gods of the pagans and to furnish funds for the upkeep of profane\nsacrifices...If today some pagan emperor\u2014God forbid!\u2014should erect an altar to\nidols and compel Christians to hold their meetings there, to attend the\nsacrifices, so that the breath and nostrils of Christians would be filled with\nthe ashes from the altar, cinders from the sacrifice, and smoke from the the\nwood...the Christian, compelled to come into the Senate, would on these\nconditions regard it as persecution....Now that you are Emperor, will\nChristians be forced to take their oath on an altar?...A decree like this\ncannot be enforced without sacrilege. I beg you not to make such a decree, nor\npass a law, nor sign a decree of this sort.\"</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>Epistle XVII</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again the entire PAGAN\n( Hindu ) Roman senators under Symmachus, gave a joint petition , signed by\nall.&nbsp; They asked the Emperor not to belittle\nHinduism \u2013 that the Altar be returned and revenues restored to the Pagan priesthood,\narguing that the fortune of Rome depended on maintaining its ancient customs\nand religious institutions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">\"Man's reason\nmoves entirely in the dark; his knowledge of divine influences can be drawn\nfrom no better source than from the recollection and the evidences of good\nfortune received from them. If long passage of time lends validity to religious\nobservances, we ought to keep faith with so many centuries, we ought to follow\nour forefathers who followed their forefathers and were blessed in so doing.\nLet us imagine that Rome herself stands in your presence and pleads with you\nthus, 'Best of emperors, fathers of your country, respect my length of years\nwon for me by the dutiful observance of rite, let me continue to practise my\nancient ceremonies, for I do not regret them. Let me live in my own way, for I\nam free. This worship of mine brought the whole world under the rule of my laws,\nthese sacred rites drove back Hannibal from my walls and the Senones [Gauls]\nfrom the Capitol'....And so we ask for peace for the gods of our fathers, for\nthe gods of our native land. It is reasonable that whatever each of us worships\nis really to be considered one and the same. We gaze up at the same stars, the\nsky covers us all, the same universe compasses us. What does it matter what\npractical system we adopt in our search for the truth? Not by one avenue only\ncan we arrive at so tremendous a secret.\"</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Relation\nIII<o:p></o:p></span></b></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MAD Bishop Ambrose scoffed\nin writing-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">\"And why should I\nsay anything of the Senones, whose entrance into the inmost Capitol the remnant\nof the Romans could not have prevented, had not a goose by its frightened\ncackling betrayed them? See what sort of protectors the Roman temples have. Where\nwas Jupiter at that time? Was he speaking in the goose? But why should I deny\nthat their sacred rites fought for the Romans? For Hannibal also worshipped the\nsame gods. Let them choose then which they will. If these sacred rites\nconquered in the Romans, then they were overcome in the Carthaginians; if they\ntriumphed in the Carthaginians, they certainly did not benefit the Romans. Let,\nthen, that invidious complaint of the Roman people come to an end. Rome has\ngiven no such charge. She speaks with other words. 'Why do you daily stain me\nwith the useless blood of the harmless herd? Trophies of victory depend not on\nthe entrails of the flocks, but on the strength of those who fight....Was there\nthen no Altar of Victory? I mourn over my downfall, my old age is tinged with\nthat shameful bloodshed. I do not blush to be converted with the whole world in\nmy old age.'\"</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>Epistle XVIII</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ambrose arm twisted the\ngullible Emperor &nbsp;Theodosius I (AD\n379-395),by threatening excommunication , and thus loss of place in heaven.&nbsp; He reminded him that he had ordered the massacre\nof thousands in the circus at Thessalonica. The chastened emperor presented\nhimself, bareheaded and in sackcloth at the cathedral in Milan. The next year,\nin AD 391, he issued the first in a series of edicts that prohibited all pagan\ncult worship and effectively made Christianity the official religion in the\nempire. They are preserved in the Codex Theodosianus, a codification of\nlegislative enactments (constitutiones) from the time of Constantine, issued by\nTheodosius II in AD 438. &nbsp;&nbsp;Divided into\ntitles and arranged chronologically, it is comprised of sixteen books, the last\nof which deals with pagans, yagnas, and Hindu temples.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">EVERY LAST VESTIGE OF GREEK AND ROMAN\nKNOWLEDGE BEFORE TWO &nbsp;MILLINIUMS WERE\nSTOLEN FROM INDIA.&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/08/secret-excavations-at-jerusalem-by.html\" style=\"background-color: yellow;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/08/secret-excavations-at-jerusalem-by.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">AFTER THIS PERIOD THE WHITE MAN GOT KNOWLEDGE\nVIA THE ARABS , WHO BOUGHT IT FROM INDIA , READY MADE AND TRANSLATED INTO\nARABIC FOR GOLD.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/01/mansa-musa-king-of-mali-and-sri.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/01/mansa-musa-king-of-mali-and-sri.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">THE WHITE MAN HAS NO DISCOVERIES / INVENTIONS\nTILL HE INVADED INDIA.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/07/brahma-and-sarawati-abraham-and-sara.html\" style=\"background-color: yellow;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/07/brahma-and-sarawati-abraham-and-sara.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Following bloody riots in Alexandria, the PAGAN\nTemple of Serapis was destroyed by a Christian mob.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The LIBRARY OF ALEXANDRIA was gutted\ndestroying all evidence of the glorious Pagan ( hindu ) culture of this entire\npart of the planet and of <b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Indian Hindu messiah Apollonius . &nbsp;&nbsp;</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>Jesus was substituted.&nbsp; &nbsp;</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">As Prudentius confessed a decade or so later:\n\"I love a temple of the heart, not one of marble.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-iAxgsj-5bvc/Vu5sGW1r30I/AAAAAAABGX8/SRXcY4xuNuIbsrFGWN659q-1Gqe5p-3gg/s1600/rncse29.2-mo3ore1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-iAxgsj-5bvc/Vu5sGW1r30I/AAAAAAABGX8/SRXcY4xuNuIbsrFGWN659q-1Gqe5p-3gg/s640/rncse29.2-mo3ore1.jpg\" width=\"390\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-ruuq8WHyvIA/Vu5snQ-GggI/AAAAAAABGYA/oNOgb_9AEmUmbcdP5PgqSNy_5HS5itm7Q/s1600/temple-ossaf-serapis-ephesus.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"238\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-ruuq8WHyvIA/Vu5snQ-GggI/AAAAAAABGYA/oNOgb_9AEmUmbcdP5PgqSNy_5HS5itm7Q/s640/temple-ossaf-serapis-ephesus.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The destruction of the\nTemple of Serapis (the Serapeum) at Alexandria is related in the ecclesiastical\nhistories of the Vatican Pope . Encouraged by the imperial edict addressed to\nthe prefect of Rome prohibiting pagan worship (CTh. XVI.10.10), Theophilus, the\npatriarch of Alexandria, took the Hindu multiarmed idols and contemptuously\nparaded them in the street, holding them up to ridicule.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Pagan Hindu\npopulation took extreme umbrage and massive riots followed where newly\nconverted Christians were all killed.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Within\nweeks after promulgating his first edict in February AD 391, Theodosius I was\nobliged to reiterate the prohibition against pagan worship (CTh. XVI.10.11),\nthis time in a rescript addressed to the prefect and military governor in\nEgypt.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The slain convert Christians\nwere declared the slain Christians to be martyrs by the Emperor.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Like in India the main Hindu\nidol of Lord Krishna sheathed in gold and diamonds levitated in the Temple of Serapis .<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Serapeum was elevated\non an enormous platform, a hundred or more steps high. In it there was a statue\nof Serapis so large that its right hand touched one wall and its left the other\n[built to house only the statue, the temple itself was not very large]; this\nmonster is said to have been made of every kind of metal and wood. The interior\nwalls of the shrine were believed to have been covered with plates of gold\noverlaid with silver and then bronze, the last a protection for the more\nprecious metals\" (Ecclesiastical History, XI.23). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On the day that an\nimage of the sun was to be carried into the Serapeum, a small window allowed a\nray of sunlight to fall on the lips of the statue in a kiss of renewal. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hidden magnets\nsuspended the image in the air, and the walls were believed to be covered with\nplates of gold overlaid with silver and then bronze. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Clement of Alexandria\nsays that the sculptor of the statue&nbsp;&nbsp; \"employed\nin its execution a mixture of various materials. For he had filings of gold,\nand silver, and lead, and in addition, tin; and of Egyptian stones not one was\nwanting, and there were fragments of sapphire, and hematite, and emerald, and\ntopaz. Having ground down and mixed together all these ingredients, he gave to\nthe composition a blue colour, whence the darkish hue of the image.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Exhortation\nto the Heathen (IV)<o:p></o:p></span></b></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Christians hesitated,\nhowever, to desecrate the figure of Serapis itself, fearful that, \"if a\nhuman hand touched the statue, the earth would split open on the spot and\ncrumble into the abyss, while the sky would crash down at once\" (II.23).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Then, at the\ninstigation of Theophilus, one of the soldiers took an axe and struck the god\non the jaw. Everyone cried out but, when the sky did not fall, the head was\nchopped off. Theodoret (Ecclesiastical History, V.22) to the glee of the\nChristian converts .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The rest of the huge idol was broken into pieces, the head\ncarried through the town and the god burned in front of the sullen pagans who\nhad worshiped him. Later, when the temple itself was being razed to the ground.&nbsp; This Hindu temple was demolished, to be\nreplaced by a martyr's shrine and a church.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The images of the gods,\nrecords Socrates, were melted down to be made into pots and other utensils for\nthe church, except for one statue of the god, which Theophilus spared as a\nreminder that such images ever had been worshiped (<b>Ecclesiastical History, V.16</b>).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Later, the Namboodiri woman\nmathematician Hypatia would be murdered by a Christian mob in an revenge assault\ninstigated by Cyril, the bishop's nephew and successor. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With her death, the\nglory of Alexandria finally was extinguished. &nbsp;&nbsp;Hypatia was on deputation to the Alexandia\nschool of Math , the wife of a Namboodiri Astronomer / Ayurveda professor, from\nthe Kodungallur University , owned by the Calicut King ( my hometown )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"...so rapid, yet\nso gentle, was the fall of Paganism, that only twenty-eight years after the\ndeath of Theodosius, the faint and minute vestiges were no longer visible to\nthe eye of the legislator.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gibbon,\nDecline and Fall of the Roman Empire (XXVIII)<o:p></o:p></span></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/03/kodungallur-bharani-festival-capt-ajit.html\" style=\"background-color: yellow;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/03/kodungallur-bharani-festival-capt-ajit.html</a><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-size: large;\">Below: Female PAGAN professor Hypatia who was tortured and killed by the Christian converts . She was pulled down from her chariot, and dragged naked through the streets.</span></b><br />\n<b><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-N61QKxRt8tY/Vu5ztIIGQSI/AAAAAAABGYU/wPAQXQHxd98EWWmlJJko6Kfs7qvzf9VbQ/s1600/dispgglay-104.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-N61QKxRt8tY/Vu5ztIIGQSI/AAAAAAABGYU/wPAQXQHxd98EWWmlJJko6Kfs7qvzf9VbQ/s640/dispgglay-104.jpg\" width=\"426\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Her father Theon was a\nprofessor in Geometry and Math. &nbsp;&nbsp;The University\nof Alexandria was headed by a Namboodiri professor named Orestes . &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-h_5qDL5zouc/Vu53RQFzecI/AAAAAAABGYo/ym1aVGJhaQAnuNqom2-RUwU7klIpoHzRg/s1600/Mort_de_la_philsswosophe_Hypatie.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"444\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-h_5qDL5zouc/Vu53RQFzecI/AAAAAAABGYo/ym1aVGJhaQAnuNqom2-RUwU7klIpoHzRg/s640/Mort_de_la_philsswosophe_Hypatie.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The great Library of Alexandria had a million\nbooks on its shelves containing Pagan knowledge . As a professor at the\nuniversity, Hypatia &nbsp;and her father Theon\nwere always inside this library.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">Below: Hypatia teaching in the University of Alexandria which has PAGAN ( Hindu ) professors.</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-WHGqfqME5Y0/Vu52GKk6dCI/AAAAAAABGYg/64MLeceEL04BtCil1HxYhSuFupgDb1fMw/s1600/agoravvg1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"470\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-WHGqfqME5Y0/Vu52GKk6dCI/AAAAAAABGYg/64MLeceEL04BtCil1HxYhSuFupgDb1fMw/s640/agoravvg1.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hypatia's death ( hacked into pieces on the\nstreets ) is a watershed mark in history delineating the classical age of Hindu\npaganism from the age of Christianity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For burning down the University\nof Alexandria and its library , causing a mass exodus of Pagan intellectuals Cyril,\nand Christianization of Alexandra, Cyril was later declared a saint by the\nchurch for his efforts in suppressing BAD paganism and fighting for the true and\nGOOD Christian faith.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cyril was made Pope or Patriarch of Alexandria\non 18 October 412<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Honorius and\nTheodosius issued one of their final edicts regarding pagans (CTh. XVI.10.22)\nin AD 423, they felt obliged to remark that \"We now believe that there are\nnone.\" The ancient temples and those who had worshipped there were no\nmore.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Constantine the Great converted\nto Christianity and was baptised on his deathbed, thus making him the first\nChristian emperor.</span> &nbsp;<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Constantine\nwas baptised by Pope Sylvester I .&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Why not ?&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Under Pope Gregory I,\nthe caverns, grottoes, crags and glens that had once been used for the worship\nof the pagan gods were now appropriated by Christianity: \"Let altars be\nbuilt and relics be placed there\" wrote Pope Gregory I, \"so that [the\npagans] have to change from the worship of the daemones to that of the true God<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the year 300 AD,\nChristianity was a minority religion in the Roman Empire, practiced by less than\n4% &nbsp;of the population.. By 400 AD, a\ncentury later, it had become the official religion practiced by pretty much\neveryone. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Evidence of this remarkable transformation can\nstill be seen in Rome\u2019s monuments. Like Babri Masjid , every time a Christian\nCathedral was renovated , while digging the foundation they would find a pagan\ntemple. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Example - At the\nBasilica di San Clemente lies a subterranean temple to the pagan god Mithras.\nMost of these ancient churches have left the pagan temples under it subterranean\ncellars as these pagan structures with an inherent Shiva Lingam &nbsp;hold the power. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;San Clemente has a &nbsp;&nbsp;4th\ncentury mosaic from Santa Pudenziana. Here Christ sits enthroned in a pose\nidentical to many statues of the pagan god Jupiter ( Brihaspati ) . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; Sirius (Mrgavyadha \"deer hunter ) rises just before the Sun on the morning of June 19th, exactly 365 days, 6 hours, 9 minutes, and 9.54 seconds after its last rising.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">In Sanskrit , and my language Malayalam KANYA STHREE means \"Virgin\" Woman -- or a Roman Catholic nun.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-size: 17.6px; line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">Bethelehem in Yiddish is house of bread.&nbsp; When the new spring sun rose at Mina Pisces, Virgo was standing on the western horizon, for it is exactly opposite to Pisces in the zodiac.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; clear: both; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; line-height: 24.64px; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em; text-decoration: none;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-e9vqLVYMoBU/VfpquXgVf4I/AAAAAAAA9nY/hcWucaEMd2Q/s400/58823y72_f260.jpg\" style=\"background: rgb(255, 255, 255); border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.0980392) 1px 1px 5px; padding: 5px; position: relative;\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; clear: both; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; line-height: 24.64px; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; clear: both; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; line-height: 24.64px; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-b1RgRYYwAOQ/VfppRlRtsnI/AAAAAAAA9m8/LN5OTIxI8fQ/s1600/sky_uuema1.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"color: #888888; margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em; text-decoration: none;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"410\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-b1RgRYYwAOQ/VfppRlRtsnI/AAAAAAAA9m8/LN5OTIxI8fQ/s640/sky_uuema1.gif\" style=\"background: rgb(255, 255, 255); border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.0980392) 1px 1px 5px; padding: 5px; position: relative;\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>In 7000 year old Rig\nVeda , Mitra is invoked as one of the protectors of laws and treaties. &nbsp; &nbsp;Sometimes it is combined as Mitra- Varuna again the guardians of RTA ( order\nand truth ).<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Below: Mithra the PAGAN Hindu god of the Roman senators springing to birth from the womb ( BRAHMANADA )&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-yxtwXaEjwZQ/Vu6RZQF60_I/AAAAAAABGZ8/zOkmAY-7Jv0WM6PzrJ5Q4vgzoo9wEe9dw/s1600/biblianaddzar33_20.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-yxtwXaEjwZQ/Vu6RZQF60_I/AAAAAAABGZ8/zOkmAY-7Jv0WM6PzrJ5Q4vgzoo9wEe9dw/s640/biblianaddzar33_20.jpg\" width=\"471\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">HYMN LIX. Mitra. RIG\nVEDA&nbsp; 5000 BC<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1. MITRA, when\nspeaking, stirreth men to labour: <b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">Mitra sustaineth both the earth and heaven</b>.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mitra beholdeth men\nwith eyes that close not. To Mitra bring, with holy oil, oblation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2 Foremost be he who\nbrings thee food, O Mitra, who strives to keep thy sacred Law, \u0100ditya.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He whom thou helpest\nne\u2019er is slain or conquered, on him, from near or far, falls no affliction.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3 joying in sacred food\nand free from sickness, with knees bent lowly on the earth's broad surface,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Following closely the\n\u0100ditya's statute, may we remain in Mitra's gracious favour.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4 Auspicious and\nadorable, this Mitra was born with fair dominion, King, Disposer.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">May we enjoy the grace\nof him the Holy, yea, rest in his propitious loving-kindness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">5 The great \u0100ditya, to\nbe served with wor. ship, who stirreth men, is gracious to the singer.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To Mitra, him most\nhighly to be lauded, offer in fire oblation that he loveth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">6 The gainful grace of\nMitra,. God, supporter of the race of man, Gives splendour of most.glorious\nfame.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">7 Mitra whose glory\nspreads afar, he who in might surpasses heaven, Surpasses earth in his renown.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">8 All the Five Races\nhave repaired to <b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Mitra,</b> ever strong to aid, For <b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">he sustaineth all the Gods</b>.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">9 Mitra to Gods, to\nliving men, to him who strews the holy grass, Gives food fulfilling sacred Law.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Below: At 0.56 you can hear MITRA VARUNA&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/hjduAAvCD8E/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/hjduAAvCD8E?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bhagya {</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092d\u093e\u0917\u094d\u092f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\nfortune } Suktam { Vedic Hymn </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u0942\u0915\u094d\u0924\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"> } <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0950</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u0930\u093e\u0924\u0930\u0917\u094d\u0928\u093f\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u0930\u093e\u0924\u0930\u093f\u0928\u094d\u0926\u094d\u0930\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0939\u0935\u093e\u092e\u0939\u0947</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u0930\u093e\u0924\u0930\u094d\u092e\u093f\u0924\u094d\u0930\u093e\u0935\u0930\u0941\u0923\u093e\u092a\u094d\u0930\u093e\u0924\u0930\u0936\u094d\u0935\u093f\u0928\u093e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n| <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u0930\u093e\u0924\u0930\u094d\u092d\u0917\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u0930\u093e\u0924\u0903</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u094b\u092e\u092e\u0941\u0924</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0930\u0941\u0926\u094d\u0930\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0939\u0941\u0935\u0947\u092e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n||<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Aum <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">pr\u0101taraghni\u1e43\npr\u0101tarindra\u1e43 hav\u0101mahe pr\u0101tar<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">mitr\u0101varu\u1e47\u0101</b>pr\u0101tara\u015bvin\u0101 | <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">pr\u0101tarbhagha\u1e43 p\u016b\u1e63a\u1e47a\u1e43\nbrahma\u1e47as pati\u1e43 pr\u0101ta\u1e25 somamuta rudra\u1e43 huvema ||<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">MEANING : 1. AGNI at\ndawn, and Indra we invoke at dawn, and Varu\u1e47a and Mitra, and the A\u015bvins twain.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Bhaga at dawn, P\u016b\u1e63an,\nand Brahma\u1e47aspati, Soma at dawn, Rudra we will invoke at dawn.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0905\u0930\u094d\u0925</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n: </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0939\u092e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u094d\u0930\u093e\u0924</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n:&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0915\u0947</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u092e\u092f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u0930</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0905\u0917\u094d\u0928\u093f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n, </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0935\u0930\u0941\u0923</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n,</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0907\u0928\u094d\u0926\u094d\u0930</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; ,</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092e\u093f\u0924\u094d\u0930</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n,</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0905\u0936\u094d\u0935\u093f\u0928</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0915\u0941\u092e\u093e\u0930</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n,</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092d\u0917</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n, </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u0942\u0937</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
