Ajit Vadakayil<br />\nJanuary 31, 2016 at 10:13 PM<br />\nhi ar,<br />\n<br />\nTYNA was part of Cappadocia, where the REAL Jesus Christ was born\u2014an Indian named Appollonius.<br />\n<br />\nHittites were Hindus ( pagan ) of Indian origin. The Hittites are mentioned more than 50 times in the Bible.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/10/true-founder-of-christianity-jesus.html<br />\n<br />\nThe LIES of white men wont work !<br />\n<br />\nThe Stonehenge of Gobleki Tepi has Namboodiri priests .<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/08/the-yazidis-of-iraq-ethnic-cleansing-by.html<br />\n<br />\nWhen God delivered Canaan to the Israelites, one of the given reasons for destroying the inhabitants was to eliminate the pagan practices which would ensnare God\u2019s people (Exodus 23:28-33). God didn't want His people following the idolatry of the Hittites.<br />\n<br />\nThe Hittites generously allowed Abraham to bury his wife Sarah on their land for free, although Abraham insisted on paying them for it (Gen 23:10-12).<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/07/brahma-and-sarawati-abraham-and-sara.html<br />\n<br />\nUriah the Hittite ( Pagan/ Hindu ) was one of the most powerful warriors in King David\u2019s army (2 Sam 11:3) and even long after the nation of Israel returned from captivity hundreds of years later, the Hittites were still a formidable nation to deal with (Ezra 9:1).<br />\n<br />\nDavid was Solomon\u2019s father. Solomon\u2019s mother was a Namboodiri woman named Bath Sheba.<br />\n<br />\nQUOTE: God wanted the Hittites out of the Promised Land was so that they wouldn\u2019t pollute the Israelites worship and mix their false, pagan gods with the one true God (Ex 23).UNQUOTE<br />\n<br />\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RmTg2_ZCW9s<br />\n<br />\nThe origin of the Decalogue was in Pagan ( Hindu ) documents written by Hittites which were plagiarized and added to by ancient Hebrew Namboodiri writers.<br />\n<br />\nThe Decalogue is the original source of the legal system of the English speaking West\u2014lifted from the religious writings of Hittites .<br />\n<br />\nThere are almost two dozen verses in the Hebrew and Christian Scriptures which state or imply that Moses was the author of Exodus and Deuteronomy.<br />\n<br />\nThis is a LIE\u2014it was wriiten by a Hindu named Jethro.<br />\n<br />\nThe Christian world LIES that God spoke the Ten Commandments to Moses who later recorded them circa 1450 BCE, as part of the Pentateuch -- the first five books of the Bible.<br />\n<br />\nAll this was Jethro\u2019s work.<br />\n<br />\nThe third set in Deuteronomy is often considered to be a review of the previous two sets.<br />\n<br />\nJethro used Yahweh/Jehovah as the divine name.<br />\n<br />\nThe Hittite documents and the Ten Commandments are both divided into the same six sections: stating the name of the ruler, his status, benefits to the people, detailed description of their obligations, \"Heaven and earth and various natural features... called to witness\" the treaty, 6 and sanctions for non-compliance. Hebrew Scripture's Ten Commandments were based on documents written by the Hindu ( pagan ) Hittites.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2-</div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_99BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n<div class=\"comment-thread inline-thread\" id=\"bc_0_98T\" kind=\"t\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; margin: 8px 0px; padding: 0.5em 1em;\" t=\"0\" u=\"0\">\n<div class=\"thread-dropContainer thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_98TD\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_99b+seedRp6VD\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_98TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_98TN\"><span class=\"thread-drop\"></span></span></span></span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_99b+seedRp6VD\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_98TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_98TN\">\n</span></span><br />\n</span><br />\n<ol class=\"thread-chrome thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_98TC\" style=\"list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\"><span id=\"bc_0_99b+seedRp6VD\" kind=\"d\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_98B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom-width: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c1453533238159317620\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_98M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2012/07/brahma-and-sarawati-abraham-and-sara.html?showComment=1454258695670#c1453533238159317620\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">January 31, 2016 at 10:14 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_98MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1-<br />\n<br />\nIn Joshua\u2019s day the Hittites are described as inhabiting the land that covered an area \u201cfrom the wilderness and this Lebanon to the great river, the river Euphrates, that is, all the land of the Hittites.\u201d (Jos 1:4)<br />\n<br />\nHittites worshipped the SHIVA LINGAM like the other Canaanite religions. When Abraham\u2019s grandson Esau married Hittite women, this was \u201ca source of bitterness of spirit to Isaac and Rebekah,\u201d Esau\u2019s father and mother.\u2014Ge 26:34, 35; 27:46.<br />\n<br />\nGod described the land that the Hittites and other associated nations occupied as \u201ca land flowing with milk and honey.\u201d (Ex 3:8)<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n\u201c The Hittites in their mountain stronghold would be a formidable foe\u201d. (De 7:1, 2)<br />\n<br />\nUriah was a Hindu Hitite whose wife\u2019s name was Bath Sheba.<br />\n<br />\nKing David saw Uriah's wife naked taking an open bath as was Kerala Namboodiri custom and usurped her.<br />\n<br />\nSolomon was born to Bath Sheba from David\u2019s seed.<br />\n<br />\nKing Solomon levied men from among the Hittites for slavish forced labor. (2Ch 8:7, 8) However, his foreign wives, among whom were Hittite women, caused Solomon to turn away from Jehovah his God. (1Ki 11:1-6)<br />\n<br />\nJehovah, speaking through the prophet Ezekiel, used the term \u201cHittite\u201d in a figurative sense in speaking to Jerusalem. He said: \u201cYour origin and your birth were from the land of the Canaanite. Your father was the Amorite, and your mother was a Hittite.\u201d (Eze 16:3)<br />\n<br />\nThrough King David, sitting on \u201cJehovah\u2019s throne\u201d (1Ch 29:23), with the ark of the covenant on Mount Zion, and finally, the glorious temple built by David\u2019s son Solomon, the fame of Jerusalem came to be spread about among the nations. But Jerusalem became like the Canaanite nations around her, corrupt and immoral, for which Jehovah finally brought desolation upon her.\u2014Eze 16:14, 15.<br />\n<br />\nSorry Rothschild !<br />\n<br />\nSorry Pope !!<br />\n<br />\nMY REVELATIONS HAVE JUMPED FROM 14.0% TO A FAAALTHU 14.05 %<br />\n<br />\nCapt Ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_99b+seedRp6VD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_99b+seedRp6VD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>APPOLLOIUS\nWAS THE REAL JESUS !</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/10/true-founder-of-christianity-jesus.html\" style=\"background-color: yellow;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/10/true-founder-of-christianity-jesus.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>JETHRO\nWAS THE REAL MOSES.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">JETHRO\nthe true MOSES studies here -- he was a namboodiri.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Jethro\n( Judaism ) and Appolonius ( Christianity ) have been DELETED from history. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Jethro\ninitiated Moses and Aaron into the worship of Jehovah or Yahweh ( Shiva ) \u2014the\nRabbis know this, yet they prefer to hide this .Jethro is introduced in Exodus\n2:18. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In\nfront of the elders , Jethro criticized Moses for his penchant to micro manage\nall affairs. This showed that the people considered Jethro bigger than Moses. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Moses\ntakes Jethro's permission to start his journey (Exodus 4:18).JETHRO AND NOT\nMOSES WAS THE FIRST PRIEST OF THE PROMISED LAND .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">AARON\nAND MOSES WERE 100% UNDER JETHROs CONTROL.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The\nBible which removed Appolonius and inserted Jesus does NOT talk about Yahweh or\nany god of the Israelis. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Today\nLatin letters YHWH is god of Israel. It is nothing but a crude form of AHAM\nBRAHMASMI- passage in Exodus 3:14 in which God gives his name as Ehyeh Asher\nEhyeh <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The\nEden of Genesis (2:8) is Kerala ( KODUNGALLUR ) in India.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Moses\nhas two sons with the daughter of Jethro, Zipporah- Gershom and Eliezer.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Dark\nskinned Zipporah, cuts her son\u2019s foreskin ( circumcision ) with a sharp stone\nas a sacrifice to God . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Jethro\nis revered as the spiritual founder, chief prophet, and ancestor of all Druze.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">LITTLE\nDO THESE JEWS KNOW THAT MOSES, DRUZE, SOLOMON, BATH SHEBA, QUEEN OF SHEBA ,\nMARY MAGDALENE \u2013ALL WERE PAGAN HINDU (from kerala).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">IT IS\nWRITTEN THAT ASHERAH IS OF FOREIGN PAGAN ORIGIN.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">'Asherah'\nwas worshipped as the Canaanite mother of all the gods representing life-giving\nand the primeval sea<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">'Baal'\nwas the Canaanite god of rain and storm who eventually became king of gods<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Israelites\nworshipped Baal and Asherah.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In\nMesapotamia Asherah was symbolised by the PAGAN tree, the peepal. ( female\ngender of banyan tree ) <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Moses,\nforbade the worship of Asherah. The Law specified that a grove of trees was not\nto be near the altar of the Lord (Deuteronomy 16:21). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Despite\nGod\u2019s clear instructions, Asherah-worship was a perennial problem in Israel. &nbsp; As\nSolomon slipped into idolatry, one of the pagan deities he brought into the\nkingdom was Asherah, called \u201cthe goddess of the Sidonians\u201d (1 Kings 11:5, 33). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Later,\nJezebel made Asherah-worship even more prevalent, with 400 prophets of Asherah\non the royal payroll (1 Kings 18:19).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">At times, Israel experienced revival, and\nnotable crusades against Asherah-worship were led by Gideon (Judges 6:25-30),\nKing Asa (1 Kings 15:13), and King Josiah (2 Kings 23:1-7).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Here\nis a new Jewish prayer spreading like wild fire.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Jewish\nprayer book that contains a prayer to Asherah:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Ashera,\nQueen and mother of the land of my mothers, and my mothers\u2019 mothers. It is to\nyou that we still offer honey cakes in gratitude for your sweetness\u2026.-E. Sheva\nMelmed<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Moon-goddess,\nAsherah was often presented as a consort of Baal, the sun-god (Judges 3:7,\n6:28, 10:6; 1 Samuel 7:4, 12:10).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The\npriests and priestesses of Asherah also practiced divination and\nfortune-telling<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: x-large; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: lime;\">Pagan chronology (314-870 C.E)\u2014&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b>this does NOT include the GENOCIDE BY\nATTILA THE HUN,&nbsp;&nbsp; POPE LEO THE GREAT AND\nST PATRICK.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">314\nImmediately after its full legalization, the Christian Church attacks the\ngentiles (non-Christians). The Council of Ancyra denounces the worship of\nGoddess Artemis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">324\nThe emperor Constantine declares Christianity as the only official religion of\nthe Roman empire. In Dydima, Minor Asia, he sacks the Oracle of the god Apollo\nand tortures the pagan priests to death. He also evicts all non-Christian\npeoples from Mount Athos and destroys all the local Hellenic temples.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">326\nConstantine, following the instructions of his mother Helen, destroys the\ntemple of the god Asclepius in Aigeai of Cilicia and many temples of the\ngoddess Aphrodite in Jerusalem, Aphaca, Mambre, Phoenice, Baalbek, etc.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">330\nConstantine steals the treasures and statues of the pagan temples of Greece to\ndecorate Nova Roma (Constantinople), the new capital of his Empire.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">335\nConstantine sacks many pagan temples of Minor Asia and Palestine and orders the\nexecution by crucifixion of \"all magicians and soothsayers.\"\nMartyrdom of the neoplatonist philosopher Sopatrus.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">341\nFlavius Julius Constantius persecutes \"all the soothsayers and the\nHellenists.\" Many gentile Hellenes are either imprisoned or executed.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">346\nNew large scale persecutions against non-Christian peoples in Constantinople.\nBanishment of the famous orator Libanius accused as a \"magician\".<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">353 An\nedict of Constantius orders the death penalty for all kind of worship through\nsacrifices and \"idols\".<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">354 A\nnew edict orders the closing of all the pagan temples. Some of them are\nprofaned and turned into brothels or gambling rooms. Executions of pagan\npriests.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">354 A\nnew edict of Constantius orders the destruction of the pagan temples and the\nexecution of all \"idolaters\". First burning of libraries in various\ncities of the empire. The first lime factories are being organised next to the\nclosed pagan temples. A major part of the holy architecture of the pagans turns\nto lime.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">357\nConstantius outlaws all methods of divination (astrology not excluded).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">359 In\nSkythopolis, Syria, the Christians organize the first death camps for the\ntorture and executions of the arrested non-Christians from all around the\nempire.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">361 to\n363 Religious tolerance and restoration of the pagan cults declared in\nConstantinople (11th December 361) by the pagan emperor Flavius Claudius\nJulianus.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">363\nAssassination of Julianus (26th June).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">364\nEmperor Flavius Jovianus orders the burning of the Library of Antioch.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">364 An\nImperial edict (11th September) orders the death penalty for all those that\nworship their ancestral gods or practice divination (\"sileat omnibus\nperpetuo divinandi curiositas\"). Three different edicts (4th February, 9th\nSeptember, 23rd December) order the confiscation of all properties of the pagan\ntemples and the death penalty for participation in pagan rituals, even private\nones.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">365 An\nImperial edict (17th November) forbids the gentile (pagan) officers of the army\nto command Christian soldiers.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">370\nValens orders a tremendous persecution of non-Christian peoples in all the\nEastern Empire. In Antioch, among many other non-Christians, the ex-governor\nFidustius and the priests Hilarius and Patricius are executed. Tons of books\nare burnt in the squares of the cities of the Eastern Empire. All the friends\nof Julianus are persecuted (Orebasius, Sallustius, Pegasius etc.), the\nphilosopher Simonides is burned alive and the philosopher Maximus is\ndecapitated.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">372\nValens orders the governor of Minor Asia to exterminate all the Hellenes and\nall documents of their wisdom.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">373\nNew prohibition of all divination methods. The term \"pagan\" (pagani,\nvillagers, equivalent to the modern insult, \"peasants\") is introduced\nby the Christians to demean non-believers.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">375\nThe temple of god Asclepius in Epidaurus, Greece, is closed down by the\nChristians.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">380 On\n27th February, Christianism becomes the exclusive religion of the Roman empire\nby an edict of the emperor Flavius Theodosius, requiring that:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">All\nthe various nations which are subject to our clemency and moderation should\ncontinue in the profession of that religion which was delivered to the Romans\nby the divine Apostle Peter.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The\nnon-Christians are called \"loathsome, heretics, stupid and blind\". In\nanother edict, Theodosius calls \"insane\" those that do not believe to\nthe Christian God and outlaws all disagreements with the Church dogmas.\nAmbrosius, bishop of Milan, starts destroying all the pagan temples of his\narea. The Christian priests lead the hungry mob against the temple of goddess\nDemeter in Eleusis and try to lynch the hierophants Nestorius and Priskus. The\n95 years old hierophant Nestorius ends the Eleusinian Mysteries and announces\nthe predominance of mental darkness over the human race.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">381 On\n2nd May, Theodosius deprives of all their rights the Christians that return\nback to the pagan religion. In all the Eastern Empire the pagan temples and\nLibraries are looted or burned down. On 21st December, Theodosius outlaws even\nsimple visits to the temples of the Hellenes. In Constantinople, the temple of\ngoddess Aphrodite is turned to a brothel and the temples of Sun and Artemis to\nstables.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">382\n\"Hellelujah\" (\"Glory to Yahweh\") is imposed in the\nChristian mass.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">384\nTheodosius orders the Praetorian Prefect Maternus Cynegius, a dedicated\nChristian, to cooperate with the local bishops and destroy the temples of the\npagans in Northern Greece and Minor Asia.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">385 to\n388 Maternus Cynegius, encouraged by his fanatic wife, and bishop\n\"Saint\" Marcellus with his gangs scour the countryside and sack and\ndestroy hundreds of Hellenic temples, shrines and altars. Among others they\ndestroy the temple of Edessa, the Cabeireion of Imbros, the temple of Zeus in\nApamea, the temple of Apollo in Dydima and all the temples of Palmyra.\nThousands of innocent pagans from all sides of the empire suffer martyrdom in\nthe notorious death camps of Skythopolis.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">386\nTheodosius outlaws (16th June) the care of the sacked pagan temples.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">388\nPublic talks on religious subjects are outlawed by Theodosius. The old orator\nLibanius sends his famous epistle \"Pro Templis\" to Theodosius with\nthe hope that the few remaining Hellenic temples will be respected and spared.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">389 to\n390 All non-Christian date-methods are outlawed. Hordes of fanatic hermits from\nthe desert flood the cities of the Middle East and Egypt and destroy statues,\naltars, libraries and pagan temples, and lynch the pagans. Theophilus,\nPatriarch of Alexandria, starts heavy persecutions against non-Christian\npeoples, turns the temple of Dionysos into a Christian church, burns down the\nMithraeum of the city, destroys the temple of Zeus and burlesques the pagan\npriests before they are killed by stoning. The Christian mob profanes the cult\nimages.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">391 On\n24th February, a new edict of Theodosius prohibits not only visits to pagan\ntemples but also looking at the vandalized statues. New heavy persecutions all\naround the empire. In Alexandria, Egypt, pagans, led by the philosopher\nOlympius, revolt and after some street fights they lock themselves inside the\nfortified temple of god Serapis (the Serapeion). After a violent siege, the\nChristians take over the building, demolish it, burn its famous library and\nprofane the cult images.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">392 On\n8th November, Theodosius outlaws all the non-Christian rituals and names them\n\"superstitions of the gentiles\" (gentilicia superstitio). New full\nscale persecutions against pagans. The Mysteries of Samothrace are ended and\nthe priests slaughtered. In Cyprus the local bishop \"Saint\"\nEpiphanius and \"Saint\" Tychon destroy almost all the temples of the\nisland and exterminate thousands of non-Christians. The local Mysteries of\ngoddess Aphrodite are ended. Theodosius's edict declares: \"the ones that\nwon't obey pater Epiphanius have no right to keep living in that island\".\nThe pagans revolt against the emperor and the Church in Petra, Aeropolis,\nRafia, Gaza, Baalbek and other cities of the Middle East.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">393\nThe Pythian Games, the Aktia Games and the Olympic Games are outlawed as part\nof the Hellenic \"idolatry\". The Christians sack the temples of\nOlympia.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">395\nTwo new edicts (22nd July and 7th August) cause new persecutions against\npagans. Rufinus, the eunuch Prime Minister of emperor Flavius Arcadius directs\nthe hordes of the baptized Goths (led by Alaric) to the country of the\nHellenes. Encouraged by Christian monks the barbarians sack and burn many\ncities (Dion, Delphi, Megara, Corinth, Pheneos, Argos, Nemea, Lycosoura,\nSparta, Messene, Phigaleia, Olympia, etc.), slaughter or enslave innumerable\ngentile Hellenes and burn down all the temples. Among others, they burn down\nthe Eleusinian Sanctuary and burn alive all its priests (including the\nhierophant of Mithras Hilarius).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">396 On\n7th December, a new edict by Arcadius orders that paganism be treated as high\ntreason. Imprisonment of the few remaining pagan priests and hierophants.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">397\n\"Demolish them!\". Flavius Arcadius orders all the still standing\npagan temples to be demolished.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">398\nThe Fourth Church Council of Carthage prohibits to everybody, including to the\nChristian bishops, the study of the books of the pagans. Porphyrius, bishop of\nGaza, demolishes almost all the pagan temples of his city (except 9 of them\nthat remain active).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">399\nWith a new edict (13th July) Flavius Arcadius orders all the still standing\npagan temples, mainly in the countryside, to be immediately demolished.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">400\nBishop Nicetas destroys the Oracle of the god Dionysus in Vesai and baptizes\nall the non-Christians of this area.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">401\nThe Christian mob of Carthage lynches non-Christians and destroys temples and\n\"idols\". In Gaza too, the local bishop \"Saint\" Porphyrius\nsends his followers to lynch pagans and to demolish the remaining 9 still\nactive temples of the city. The 15th Council of Chalkedon orders all the\nChristians that still keep good relations with their gentile relatives to be\nexcommunicated (even after their death).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">405\nJohn Chrysostom sends hordes of gray dressed monks armed with clubs and iron\nbars to destroy the \"idols\" in all the cities of Palestine.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">406\nJohn Chrysostom collects funds from rich Christian women to financially support\nthe demolition of the Hellenic temples. In Ephessus he orders the destruction\nof the famous temple of goddess Artemis. In Salamis, Cyprus, \"Saints\"\nEpiphanius and Eutychius continue the persecutions of the pagans and the total\ndestruction of their temples and sanctuaries.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">407 A\nnew edict outlaws once more all the non-Christian acts of worship<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">408\nThe emperor of the Western Empire, Honorius, and the emperor of the Eastern\nEmpire, Arcadius, order together all the sculptures of the pagan temples to be\neither destroyed or to be taken away. Private ownership of pagan sculpture is\nalso outlawed. The local bishops lead new heavy persecutions against the pagans\nand new book burning. The judges that have pity for the pagans are also\npersecuted. \"Saint\" Augustine massacres hundreds of protesting pagans\nin Calama, Algeria.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">409\nAnother edict orders all methods of divination including astrology to be\npunished by death.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">415 In\nAlexandria, Egypt, the Christian mob, urged by the bishop Cyrillus, attacks a\nfew days before the Judaeo-Christian Pascha (Easter) and cuts to pieces the\nfamous and beautiful philosopher Hypatia. The pieces of her body, carried\naround by the Christian mob through the streets of Alexandria, are finally\nburned together with her books in a place called Cynaron. On 30th August, new\npersecutions start against all the pagan priests of North Africa who end their\nlives either crucified or burned alive.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">416\nThe inquisitor Hypatius, alias \"The Sword of God\", exterminates the\nlast pagans of Bithynia. In Constantinople (7th December) all non-Christian\narmy officers, public employees and judges are dismissed.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">423\nEmperor Theodosius II declares (8th June) that the religion of the pagans is nothing\nmore than \"demon worship\" and orders all those who persist in\npracticing it to be punished by imprisonment and torture.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">429\nThe temple of goddess Athena (Parthenon) on the Acropolis of Athens is sacked.\nThe Athenian pagans are persecuted.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">435 On\n14th November, a new edict by Theodosius II orders the death penalty for all\n\"heretics\" and pagans of the empire. Only Judaism is considered a\nlegal non-Christian religion.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">438\nTheodosius II issues an new edict (31st January) against the pagans,\nincriminating their \"idolatry\" as the reason of a recent plague!<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">440 to\n450 The Christians demolish all the monuments, altars and temples of Athens,\nOlympia, and other Greek cities.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">448\nTheodosius II orders all non-Christian books to be burned.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">450\nAll the temples of Aphrodisias (the City of the Goddess Aphrodite) are\ndemolished and all its libraries burned down. The city is renamed Stavroupolis\n(City of the Cross).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">451\nNew edict by Theodosius II (4th November) emphasises that \"idolatry\"\nis punished by death.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">457 to\n491 Sporadic persecutions against the pagans of the Eastern Empire. Among\nothers, the physician Jacobus and the philosopher Gessius are executed.\nSeverianus, Herestios, Zosimus, Isidorus and others are tortured and\nimprisoned. The proselytiser Conon and his followers exterminate the last\nnon-Christians of Imbros Island, Norheast Aegean Sea. The last worshippers of\nLavranius Zeus are exterminated in Cyprus.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">482 to\n488 The majority of the pagans of Minor Asia are exterminated after a desperate\nrevolt against the emperor and the Church.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">486\nMore \"underground\" pagan priests are discovered, arrested,\nburlesqued, tortured and executed in Alexandria, Egypt.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">515\nBaptism becomes obligatory even for those that already say they are Christians.\nThe emperor of Constantinople, Anastasius, orders the massacre of the pagans in\nthe Arabian city Zoara and the demolition of the temple of local godndrites.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">528\nEmperor Jutprada (Justinianus) outlaws the \"alternative\" Olympian\nGames of Antioch. He also orders the execution\u2014by fire, crucifixion, tearing to\npieces by wild beasts or cutting to pieces by iron nails\u2014of all who practice\n\"sorcery, divination, magic or idolatry\" and prohibits all teachings\nby the pagans (\"the ones suffering from the blasphemous insanity of the\nHellenes\").<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">529\nJustinianus outlaws the Athenian Philosophical Academy and has its property\nconfiscated.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">532\nThe inquisitor Ioannis Asiacus, a fanatic monk, leads a crusade against the\npagans of Minor Asia.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">542\nJustinianus allows the inquisitor Ioannis Asiacus to convert the pagans of\nPhrygia, Caria and Lydia, Minor Asia. Within 35 years of this crusade, 99\nchurches and 12 monasteries are built on the sites of demolished pagan temples.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">546\nHundreds of pagans are put to death in Constantinople by the inquisitor Ioannis\nAsiacus.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">556\nJustinianus orders the notorious inquisitor Amantius to go to Antioch, to find,\narrest, torture and exterminate the last non-Christians of the city and burn\nall the private libraries down.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">562\nMass arrests, burlesquing, tortures, imprisonments and executions of gentile\nHellenes in Athens, Antioch, Palmyra and Constantinople.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">578 to\n582 The Christians torture and crucify gentile Hellenes all around the Eastern\nEmpire, and exterminate the last non-Christians of Heliopolis (Baalbek).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">580\nThe Christian inquisitors attack a secret temple of Zeus in Antioch. The priest\ncommits suicide, but the rest of the pagans are arrested. All the prisoners,\nthe Vice Governor Anatolius included, are tortured and sent to Constantinople\nto face trial. Sentenced to death they are thrown to the lions. The wild\nanimals being unwilling to tear them to pieces, they end up crucified. Their\ndead bodies are dragged in the streets by the Christian mob and afterwards\nthrown unburied in the dump.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">583\nNew persecutions against the gentile Hellenes by the Mauricius.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">590 In\nall the Eastern Empire the Christian accusers \"discover\" pagan\nconspiracies. New storm of torture and executions.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">692\nThe \"Penthekto\" Council of Constantinople prohibits the remains of\nCalends, Brumalia, Anthesteria, and other pagan/Dionysian celebrations.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">804\nThe gentile Hellenes of Mesa Mani (Cape Tainaron, Lakonia, Greece) resist\nsuccessfully the attempt of Tarasius, Patriarch of Constantinople, to convert\nthem to Christianity.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">850 to\n860 Violent conversion of the last gentile Hellenes of Laconia by the Armenian\n\"Saint\" Nikon.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c8187940026061206571\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_185M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; text-decoration: none;\">March 20, 2016 at 5:00 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_185MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nNamaste Ajit,<br />\nWonderful info as usual. font-size: large;\"><b>EVERY SINGLE MAGNIFICENT RUINS IN EGYPT, GREECE , ROME , PALESTINE AND EUROPE WAS BUILT BY HINDUS .</b></span><br />\n<br />\npagan names had meanings in the language people spoke<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/08/imhotep-patron-saint-of-freemasons-capt.html</span><br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_185b+seedO3mHD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_185b+seedO3mHD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the final decade of\nthe sixth century AD, the Pagan temple Parthenon was converted into a Christian\nchurch dedicated to the Virgin Mary. &nbsp; &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Roman Emperor\nTheodosius wiped out the last vestige of the Olympian Pagan gods when he\nabolished the Olympic Games in 394 A.D.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-OHeQ6Nip6EE/Vu76ExetBmI/AAAAAAABGbY/L1TewFuXWjgi4ixNlqJr04SEdyIBcromQ/s1600/3477698-The33Parthenon-atop-the-Acropolis-2.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-OHeQ6Nip6EE/Vu76ExetBmI/AAAAAAABGbY/L1TewFuXWjgi4ixNlqJr04SEdyIBcromQ/s640/3477698-The33Parthenon-atop-the-Acropolis-2.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>WHEN BILL CLINTON SPOKE TO OUR MPs , HE ASKED\n--<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>\" WHY CANT THE REST OF INDIA BE LIKE KERALA\".\n<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>BEING A FREEMASON HE KNOWS !<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>WHEN THE KERALA MPs DID NOT REACT , HE ASKED <o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Christmas on 25<sup>th</sup>\nDec was first celebrated in Rome in 336 AD<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Before that Pagans\ncelebrated 25<sup>th</sup> Dec and SHANI day ( Saturnalia )<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-KbSLkU7l5fI/Vu6mOBxayfI/AAAAAAABGbE/DdhrGzAL0rMusla0i5_vSD00RLJrriEPg/s1600/temFp-17-638.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-KbSLkU7l5fI/Vu6mOBxayfI/AAAAAAABGbE/DdhrGzAL0rMusla0i5_vSD00RLJrriEPg/s640/temFp-17-638.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Saturnalia on 25<sup>th</sup>\nDec was the biggest festival in the Roman empire.&nbsp; In Rome , the holiday was celebrated with a\nsacrifice at the Temple of Saturn, in the Roman Forum, and a public banquet,\nfollowed by private gift-giving, continual partying, and a carnival atmosphere.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The poet Catullus called it \"the best of days\".<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-0LApBzuiB_E/Vu6ludBJXLI/AAAAAAABGbA/_NkEhJsWzOcyusaW7xBh9-cqzNPRLUKMg/s1600/SaturnalFia01.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; I tell you, no, but rather division;<br />\n52 for from now on five members in one household will be divided, three against two and two against three.<br />\n53 \"They will be divided, father against son and son against father, mother against daughter and daughter against mother, mother-in-law against daughter-in-law and daughter-in-law against mother-in-law.\"<br />\n<br />\nWhat does it mean?<br />\nRegards<br />\nShekhar</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_206BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_206b+seedDPD\" kind=\"d\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"comment-thread inline-thread\" id=\"bc_0_208T\" kind=\"t\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; margin: 8px 0px; padding: 0.5em 1em;\" t=\"0\" u=\"0\">\n<ol class=\"thread-chrome thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_208TC\" style=\"list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\" unselectable=\"on\"><div style=\"zoom: 1;\" unselectable=\"on\">\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_208B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 8px;\"><span id=\"bc_0_206b+seedDPD\" kind=\"d\"><div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c8047337438090402587\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_208M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"http://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">apt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/03/st-patrick-genocide-of-druids-pope-leo.html?showComment=1458498052258#c8047337438090402587\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">March 20, 2016 at 11:50 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_208MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhi s,<br />\n<br />\nI HAVE READ THE OLD TESTAMENT , SEVERAL VERSIONS.<br />\n<br />\nIT IS UNFIT TO BE PREACHED.<br />\n<br />\nWanna know what First Corinthians 7.36 says in the Old Testament?<br />\n<br />\nQUOTE: if any man thinks that he is acting unbecomingly toward his virgin daughter, if she is past her youth, and if it must be so, let him do what he wishes, he does not sin : UNQUOTE<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nWITH EVERY ABRIDGMENT AND NEW EDITION THEY AIRBRUSH INCEST<br />\n<br />\nNew International Version<br />\nIf anyone is worried that he might not be acting honorably toward the virgin he is engaged to, and if his passions are too strong and he feels he ought to marry, he should do as he wants. He is not sinning. They should get married.<br />\n<br />\nNew Living Translation<br />\nBut if a man thinks that he's treating his fiancee improperly and will inevitably give in to his passion, let him marry her as he wishes. It is not a sin.<br />\n<br />\nEnglish Standard Version<br />\nIf anyone thinks that he is not behaving properly toward his betrothed, if his passions are strong, and it has to be, let him do as he wishes: let them marry\u2014it is no sin.<br />\n<br />\nNew American Standard Bible<br />\nBut if any man thinks that he is acting unbecomingly toward his virgin daughter, if she is past her youth, and if it must be so, let him do what he wishes, he does not sin; let her marry.<br />\n<br />\nKing James Bible<br />\nBut if any man think that he behaveth himself uncomely toward his virgin, if she pass the flower of her age, and need so require, let him do what he will, he sinneth not: let them marry.<br />\n<br />\nHolman Christian Standard Bible<br />\nBut if any man thinks he is acting improperly toward his virgin, if she is past marriageable age, and so it must be, he can do what he wants. He is not sinning; they can get married.<br />\n<br />\nInternational Standard Version<br />\nIf a man thinks he is not behaving properly toward his virgin, and if his passion is so strong that he feels he ought to marry her, let him do what he wants; he isn't sinning. Let them get married.<br />\n<br />\nNET Bible<br />\nIf anyone thinks he is acting inappropriately toward his virgin, if she is past the bloom of youth and it seems necessary, he should do what he wishes; he does not sin. Let them marry.<br />\n<br />\nAramaic Bible in Plain English<br />\nBut if a man thinks he is disgraced by his virgin who is past her time and he has not given her to a man, and it is fitting to give her as he chooses to do, he does not sin; she may be married.<br />\n<br />\nGOD'S WORD\u00ae Translation<br />\nNo father would want to do the wrong thing when his virgin daughter is old enough to get married. If she wants to get married, he isn't sinning by letting her get married.<br />\n<br />\nKing James 2000 Bible<br />\nBut if any man think that he behaves himself improperly toward his virgin, if she pass the prime of her age, and need so require, let him do what he desires, he sins not: let them marry.<br />\n<br />\nAmerican King James Version<br />\nBut if any man think that he behaves himself uncomely toward his virgin, if she pass the flower of her age, and need so require, let him do what he will, he sins not: let them marry.<br />\n<br />\nAmerican Standard Version<br />\nBut if any man thinketh that he behaveth himself unseemly toward his virgin daughter , if she be past the flower of her age, and if need so requireth, let him do what he will; he sinneth not; let them marry.<br />\n<br />\nDouay-Rheims Bible<br />\nBut if any man think that he seemeth dishonoured, with regard to his virgin, for that she is above the age, and it must so be: let him do what he will; he sinneth not, if she marry.<br />\n<br />\nDarby Bible Translation<br />\nBut if any one think that he behaves unseemly to his virginity, if he be beyond the flower of his age, and so it must be, let him do what he will, he does not sin: let them marry.<br />\n<br />\nEnglish Revised Version<br />\nBut if any man thinketh that he behaveth himself unseemly toward his virgin daughter, if she be past the flower of her age, and if need so requireth, let him do what he will; he sinneth not; let them marry.<br />\n<br />\nWebster's Bible Translation<br />\nBut if any man thinketh that he behaveth himself uncomely towards his virgin, if she hath passed the flower of her age, and need so requireth, let him do what he will, he sinneth not: let them marry.<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2-</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_208MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_208BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px;
