, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>AT THE END OF THE MONTH,\nTHE EXECUTIVE MAY WITHHOLD YOUR SALARY.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>LET US NOT BREAK THE\nSYSTEM.<o:p></o:p></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>DO NOT LET THE JNU COMMIE PROFESSORS &nbsp;GET AWAY !</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-2aRwtnh24PM/VucBE-msVpI/AAAAAAABGHw/n8P5WmQerJ8T9dRfhX_nX-_IBecXYvvlg/s1600/quote-if-the-system-FFbreaks-down-the-consequences-will-still-be-very-painful-but-the-bigger-theodore-kaczynski-110-86-60.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"300\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-2aRwtnh24PM/VucBE-msVpI/AAAAAAABGHw/n8P5WmQerJ8T9dRfhX_nX-_IBecXYvvlg/s640/quote-if-the-system-FFbreaks-down-the-consequences-will-still-be-very-painful-but-the-bigger-theodore-kaczynski-110-86-60.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was P N Bhagwati and\nVR Krishna Iyer who introduced the concepts of PIL and absolute liability to\nthe Indian judicial system. &nbsp;Both\nwrangled India\u2019s second highest civilian award , the Padma Vibhushan<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Melords never cared\nto control the loudspeakers in mosques \u2013though they went hammer and tongs\nagainst every other loudspeaker.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In no Constitution in\nthe world is the power to select and appoint judges conferred on the judges\nthemselves and WE THE PEOPLE shall not have it in India.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Supreme Court has\nmade an order even in a military operation. In 1993, the Court issued orders on\nthe conduct of military operations in Hazratbal shrine, Kashmir where the\nmilitary had as a matter of strategy restricted the food supplies to hostages.\nThe Court ordered that the provision of food of 1,200 calorific value should be\nsupplied to hostages.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Commenting on this, an Army General wrote: \u201cFor the first\ntime in history, a Court of Law was asked to pronounce judgment on the conduct\nof an ongoing military operation. Its verdict materially affected the course of\noperation.\u201d &nbsp;&nbsp;This ruling we know was\ninfluenced by foreign &nbsp;forces\u2014we will NOT\nhave Judiciary interfering with India\u2019s security ever again.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even proceedings of\nLegislatures are controlled by the Court. In the Jharkhand Legislative Assembly\ncase, the Supreme Court ordered the Assembly to conduct a Motion of Confidence\nand ordered the Speaker to conduct proceedings according to a prescribed agenda\nand not to entertain any other business.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Its proceedings were ordered to be\nrecorded for reporting to the Court. These orders were made in spite of Article\n212 of the Constitution which states that Courts are not to inquire into any\nproceedings of the legislature<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-size: large;\">While the Melords have come to recognize and enforce\nrights for the most disadvantaged sections in society through an expanded\nnotion of \u2018judicial review\u2019\u2014 &nbsp;the COLLEGIUM judges must know, that like dowry complaints\nmost of these dalit complaints ( led by foreign funded NGOs ) are also false.</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The constitution\nclearly says that the executive will appoint judges after consulting the\njudiciary. Articles 124 and 217 are the relevant laws on the appointment of\njudges.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Article 124, inter\nalia, says:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cEvery Judge of the\nSupreme Court shall be appointed by the President by warrant under his hand and\nseal after consultation with such of the judges of the Supreme Court and of the\nhigh courts in the states as the President may deem necessary for the purpose\nand shall hold office until he attains the age of 65 years: Provided that in\nthe case of appointment of a judge other than the chief Justice, the chief\nJustice of India shall always be consulted.\u201d&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Article 217 says, inter\nalia: \u201cEvery judge of a high court shall be appointed by the President by\nwarrant under his hand and seal after consultation with the Chief Justice of\nIndia, the Governor of the state, and, in the case of appointment of a judge\nother than the chief Justice, the chief Justice of the high court\u2026.\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The constitution is\nclear that the executive appoints judges in consultation with the judiciary.\nNot the other way around.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is worth noting that\nin the US, judge selection is entirely a political process (existing judges\nhave no say) and in Britain (for England and Wales), the 15-member Judicial\nAppointments Commission has 15 members, among whom only five are judges. The\nchairman of the JAC is a lay person, and not a judge.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In contrast, in the\nIndian NJAC, the CJI is the head. There is no way anyone can say the new law\ndiminishes the judiciary.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As the US and UK examples\nshow, globally it is not judges who appoint judges. Moreover, democracy means\nlaws are made by elected representatives, and not judges.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Judges only have to\ninterpret the laws and check if they impinge on the basic freedoms guaranteed\nby the constitution. In recent years, judges have been foraying into DANG thing<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">VR Krishna Iyer was the\nlaw minister in India\u2019s first Communist government\u2014in Kerala\u2014making him the\nonly Supreme Court judge to have served as a politician prior to his\nappointment to the apex court.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In future we shall NOT\nhave Judges with known hardcore political leanings. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">His penchant to give\nsuccor to foreign black mambas at the expense of the watan is well known. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1987, &nbsp;VR Krishna Iyer stood as the combined\nopposition candidate in the presidential election, but lost to Congress\ncandidate R. Venkataraman.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Quoting Winston Churchill\nto highlight the importance of free and fair elections in democracy, what VR\nKrishna Iyer wrote in a judgement in 1977 : \u201cAt the bottom of all tributes paid\nto democracy is the little man, walking into a little booth, with a little\npencil, making a little cross on a little bit of paper\u2014no amount of rhetoric or\nvoluminous discussion can possibly diminish the overwhelming importance of the\npoint.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It cannot be any job of\nthe judiciary to thwart the people\u2019s will. The will of the people means the\nright to change the laws \u2013 as long as they are not in contravention of the\nbasic features of the constitution.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The NJAC may not be the\nbest thing to happen to judicial appointments, but it is ANYDAY better than the\nopaque collegium system. We can fix the warts once they are visible.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A weakened political\nclass has over the last 3 decades meekly surrendered to judicial supremacy. But\nnow Modi has a FULL majority in the Lok Sabha.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WE THE PEOPLE expect him to set right this bullshit system where lawyer turned judges play\ngod.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"line-height: 115%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>EVER HEARD\nOF JUSTICE MOHIT SHAH ?</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 115%;\"><a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/notes/mohini-kamwani/mohini-kamwanis-petition-under-article-32-against-chief-justice-mohit-shah-bomba/853543668058416/\">&nbsp;https://www.facebook.com/notes/mohini-kamwani/mohini-kamwanis-petition-under-article-32-against-chief-justice-mohit-shah-bomba/853543668058416/</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 115%;\"><a href=\"http://www.caravanmagazine.in/vantage/why-dushyant-dave-does-not-want-chief-justice-mohit-shah-supreme-court\">http://www.caravanmagazine.in/vantage/why-dushyant-dave-does-not-want-chief-justice-mohit-shah-supreme-court</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</b></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 115%;\">LONG LIVE\nOUR MELORDS !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Centre for Public\nInterest Litigation is a TROJAN HORE NGO that keeps filing PIL.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Exasperated the current\nCJI T Thakur asked-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cAre you a professional\nlitigant? What is the process (of filing cases)? Is there scrutiny?,\u201d &nbsp;\u201cYou shouldn\u2019t become an instrument in the\nhands of other interests.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The CPIL was\nestablished by late Justice V. M. Tarkunde, a former judge of the Supreme Court\nof India.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tarkunde was a founder\nof People's Union for Civil Liberties (PUCL ) along with Jayaprakash Narayan, (\na CIA spook ). &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>Arun Jaitley, Arun Shourie were all part of PUCL.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Dr Binayak Sen the\nNAXAL THINKER&nbsp; was National\nVice-President of the Union of PUCL&nbsp; and\nneatly placed a General Secretary of its Chhattisgarh unit\u2014 the naxal HUB.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; The country will be run as per the Constitution of India<br />\n<br />\n2. The country will be run as per the Constitution, as interpreted by the citizens of India<br />\n<br />\n3. The SCjs\u2019 interpretation of Constitution will be above Ministers\u2019 interpretation of the Constitution, but citizens\u2019 interpretation of the Constitution will be final and supreme and above the interpretation of SCjs..<br />\n<br />\nMPs, who were supposed to represent the citizens, were given powers to impeach the SCjs, so that if and when SCjs interpret the Constitution differently from the citizens, the MPs can impeach the SCjs.<br />\n<br />\nWHITE SKINNED PEDOPHILEs GET AWAY IN INDIATHANKS TO OUR MELORDS.<br />\nFrom 1989, a Swiss Jewish couple, Wilhelm Marty (61) a general manager of a multinational Swiss pharmaceutical firm and wife Loshiar Lily Marty (58), a trained nurse, had traveled from Switzerland to Mumbai, trawling for children.<br />\n<br />\nThe couple was caught red-handed in 2000, with six victims; girls aged between eight and nine years in a room at a five-star hotel. Their modus-operandi, according to police, was simple: They would lure poor children, and then force them to indulge in pornographic acts as they filmed them.<br />\n<br />\nThey would then post the explicit footage on the web. The couple was sentenced to seven years imprisonment. However, they were freed after undergoing half their sentence, when the court allowed them to pay compensation to their victims' families.<br />\n<br />\nMarty shouted in court \u201cYou Indians are all corrupt, we can buy you.\u201d<br />\n<br />\nTheir passports revealed that the couple had been visiting India every year since 1989. They operated in different countries and their laptop was stocked with photographs of children including those from Sri Lanka and the Philippines. Posing as a lonely, grandfatherly couple, they befriended street children and their parents, promising to give them a good time on the pretext of charity.<br />\n<br />\nMarty (who described himself as a general manager in a multinational pharmaceutical company) and his wife were well stocked with lubricants, condoms and penile sprays. Lily Marty, a trained nurse, would tend to the wounds the children suffered as a result of their abuse. Both abused the children .<br />\n<br />\nChild rights campaigners are shocked over the leniency displayed by the Indian judicial system towards foreigners who abuse children sexually.<br />\n<br />\nhttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transparent_Complaint_Procedure<br />\n<br />\nWE THE PEOPLE must use TCP draft in the Gazette :<br />\n1. style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_181M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/05/comments-overflow-for-inoperative-load_10.html?showComment=1526060471074#c2685797842938331508\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">May 11, 2018 at 11:11 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_181MC\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhttps://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/sc-collegium-agrees-in-principle-to-reitereate-justice-josephs-name-for-elevation-to-top-court/articleshow/64123835.cms<br /><br />THE ACCOUNTABLE ELECTED EXECUTIVE CAN REJECT JUDGE KM JOSEPHs ELEVATION TO SUPREME COURT --WITHOUT ASSIGNING REASONS..<br /><br />ONCE KM JOSEPHs NAME IS REJECTED--IT IS FINAL.. THERE IS NO NEED FOR THE ELECTED EXECUTIVE TO GIVE REASON--ESPECIALLY IF IT IS TO BE PUBLISHED IN THE MEDIA..<br /><br />IF UNACCOUNTABLE ( TO WE THE PEOPLE ) SUPREME COURT COLLEGIUM SENDS BACK THE SAME NAME AGAIN -- IT IS INDISCIPLINE ..<br /><br />AND NOW IT IS THE PLEASURE OF THE ELECTED EXECUTIVE TO PUNISH ( LOSS OF PROMOTION - LOSS OF SALARY RISE ) THE RECALCITRANT JUDGES...<br /><br />DO NOT REDUCE THE SANCTITY OF THE JUDICIAL SYSTEM...<br /><br />IN THE FIRST PLACE-- OUR CONSTITUTION DOES NOT ALLOW A COLLEGIUM SYSTEM..INDIA IS THE ONLY NATION ON THIS PLANET WHERE JUDGES ELECT JUDGES..<br /><br />WHO ARE THESE JUDGES ?<br /><br />ARE THEY SOME GOLDEN KNIGHTS ?<br /><br />SORRY--THESE ARE BOTTOM OF THE SCHOOL CEREBRAL BARREL LAWYERS .. OUT OF THE POOL OF LAWYERS THE LOSER FOOT SLOGGING LAWYERS BECAME JUDGES TO COCK A NOOK AT THEIR SUCCESSFUL RICH LAWYER COLLEAGUES ..<br /><br />THE EX-CJI KG BALAKRISHNAN WAS NOT EVEN QUALIFIED TO BE SUPREME COURT JUDGE--LEAVE ALONE CJI... HE WAS A CHRISTIAN MASQUERADING AS A DALIT HINDU...HIS FATHER WAS A CHRISTIAN.<br /><br />The Constitution confers the power of appointment of judges on the President of India i.e. the Government of India to be made in consultation with the Chief Justice of India and other judges of the Supreme Court. How then did a collegium of judges of the Supreme Court come to exist and come to possess this UNIQUE power?<br /><br />The Supreme Court rewrote the provisions of the Constitution for appointment of judges and appropriated the power to appoint judges by the judges-- when this is amazing Judicial over reach .<br /><br />The collegium method was created as a result of two judgments of the Supreme Court, first in 1993 (Supreme Court Advocate-on-Record Association case) and by a follow-up President\u2019s Reference to the Court in 1998<br /><br />By the first case the power was vested in the Chief Justice of India in whom it was held the primacy lay in appointments assisted by two judges of the Supreme Court. In the second case the court took away the primacy of the Chief Justice of India and vested the power in a collegium of the Chief Justice of India and four senior-most judges of the Supreme Court.<br /><br />The clear intention of the Constitution makers in the Constituent Assembly debates of not making the Chief Justice of India the final authority was disregarded.&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_181MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: medium;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_181MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n</div>\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: medium;\">Inversing the constitutional provisions, the Chief Justice of India and the collegium became the initiator and appointer of judges, and the President of India was illegally and unconstiutionally REDUCED to be a NAPUNSAK formal approver in the process. Foreign forces were involved in this humongous subversion..</span></div>\n<br />.Indeed, in the second judgment of 1998 the Court went to the extent of extracting a statement from the government that it was not seeking a reconsideration of its earlier judgment of 1993, and DEEP STATE controlled government would also accept and binding the judgment it was delivering.<br /><br />The essential features of this judicially created system of appointments is that the collegium selects judges on their own assessment of the merits of a person and the government is bound to appoint the selected person except in a rare case of the collegium having overlooked some aspect of the incumbent not being a suitable judge.<br /><br />BUT HEY-- LO AND BEHOLD - THE ELECTED EXECUTIVEs VIEW CAN BE KICKED INTO THE DUSTBIN BY THE COLLEGIUM MELORDS AND THEY COULD RESSERT THEIR CHOICE ( AS IS HAPPENING WITH KM JOSEPH NOW )<br /><br />The executive has thus ZILCH role in the appointment of judges as a result.<br /><br />OUR CONSTITUTION DOES NOT ALLOW COLLEGIUM JUDGES TO PLAY GOD.<br /><br />It is EASY to comprehend that there is FOREIGN HAND in the new hijacked system of kicking the Constitution\u2019s prescription.<br /><br /><br />CONTINUED TO 2--</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_181BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/05/comments-overflow-for-inoperative-load_10.html?showComment=1526060535018#c8186360616079631025\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">May 11, 2018 at 11:12 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_180MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1-</div>\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: medium;\">JUDICIARY CANNOT MAKE LAWS .. THIS IS THE PREROGATIVE OF THE LEGISTLATURE. JUDICIARY CAN ONLY INTERPET LAWS--AND THAT TOO WHEN ASKED FOR IT ( NOT BY VESTED PIL )..</span></div>\n<br />In prescribing the appointment to judges of the Supreme Court and the High Courts by the collegium, the Supreme Court did not realise the burden it was imposing on the collegium of selecting judges for the Supreme Court and High Courts and transferring them from one High Court to another.<br /><br />At any given time there are two to three vacancies in the Supreme Court, and 200 in the 22 High Courts and the transfer of a number of judges to be made. An administrative task of this magnitude must necessarily detract the judges of the collegium from their principal judicial work of hearing and deciding cases.<br /><br /><div>\n<span style=\"font-size: medium;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">The collegium neither has a secretariat to shoulder this burden nor an INTELLIGENCE BUREAU to make appropriate inquiries of the competence, character,&nbsp;</span><b><span style=\"color: red;\">loyalty to the watan</span></b><span style=\"color: blue;\">, and integrity of a proposed appointee.</span></span></div>\n<br />BEFORE 1947 ALMOST ALL SUPREME COURT JUDGES WERE IN THE PAYROLL OF JEW ROTHSCHILD..<br /><br />Lacking this infrastructural backup the collegium resorts to ad hoc informal consultations with other judges in the Supreme Court who are expected to know the merits of a proposed appointee from a High Court or occasionally by sounding a member of the Bar.<br /><br />These methods are poor substitutes for a full time intensive collection of data about an incumbent, his loyalty to the watan, his work, standing, merit, integrity and potential which requires to be made considerably in advance for filing in the vacancy.<br /><br />Besides, the collegium\u2019s deliberations are secret, the system is opaque and the choice of a judge is only known when his name is forwarded to the Government for formal appointment.<br /><br />IN THE RECENT PAST COLLEGIUM JUDICIARY SAVED SEVERAL TRAITORS WHO HAVE TRIED TO KILL BHARATMATA .<br /><br /><b><span style=\"color: purple;\">INDIA MUST DESTROY THE COLLEGIUM SYSTEM AND GO FOR NJAC..&nbsp; ONE STUP1D JUDGE HAD SLAPPED BOTH \"SEDITION\" AND \"CONTEMPT OF COURT \" ON ARUN JAITLEY FOR SAYING CONSTITUTION DOES NOT SUPPORT \"COLLEGIUM SYSTEM\" BUT ONLY NJAC&nbsp;</span></b><br /><br />The advantage of judicial commissions are that they are independent, broad based and they represent not only the views of the judiciary but also of the executive and other sections of society.<br /><br />IN 1993 A 9 BENCH ( SECOND JUDGES CASE ) ILLEGALLY CONVERTED \"CONSULTATION\" TO \"CONCURRANCE \"..<br /><br />THE 9 BENCH ( THIRD JUDGES CASE ) THE REDUCED THE POWERS OF THE CJI TO A MERE \"RECOMMENDER\".. IF THE PRESIDENT REJECTS THE RECOMMENDATION, THEN THE MELORDS WILL SENT IT BACK-- AND THEN THE PRESIDENT IS DUTY BOUND TO ACCEPT THE NAME ..<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>APPIDIYAAAA ?</b></span><br /><br /><div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: medium;\">BALLS-- THESE ARE SLIMY LAWS / PROCEDURES MADE BY COLLEGIUM JUDGES NOT APPROVED BY THE ELECTED LAW MAKERS.</span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: medium;\"><div>\n<br /></div>\n<div>\nCJI KHEHAR STRUCK DOWN NJAC--THIS IS THE SAME FELLOW WHO WANTED WHITE LAWYERS TO PRACTICE IN INDIA..</div>\n</span><span style=\"color: red;\"><br />http://doj.gov.in/appointment-of-judges/memorandum-procedure-appointment-supreme-court-judges<br /><br />https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Judicial_Appointments_Commission</span><br /><br />WE THE PEOPLE ARE ABOVE THE CONSTITUTION--WE WILL NOT ALLOW COLLEGIUM JUDGEs TO PLAY GOD..<br /><br />THE ABOVE IS A MOST CRITICAL COMMET--<br /><br />PUT ABOVE IN WEBSITES OF--<br />LAW MINISTER<br />ATTORNEY GENERAL<br />SUPREME COURT BAR COUNCIL<br />PMO<br />PM MODI<br />SPEAKER LOK SABHA<br />SPEAKER RAJYA SABHA<br /><br />capt ajit vadakayil<br />..</div>\n</li>\n</ol>\n</div>\n</span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: lime;\">QUOTE</b>: In 1991, Sen married Emma Georgina\nRothschild, who serves as the Jeremy and Jane Knowles Professor of History at\nHarvard University. Sen is an atheist and holds that this can be associated\nwith one of the atheist schools in Hinduism, the Lokayata.[36][37][38] In an\ninterview for the magazine California, which is published by the University of\nCalifornia, Berkeley, he noted:[39]<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In some ways people had got used to the idea\nthat India was spiritual and religion-oriented. That gave a leg up to the\nreligious interpretation of India, despite the fact that Sanskrit had a larger\natheistic literature than what exists in any other classical language.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Madhava\nAcharya</b>, the remarkable 14th century philosopher, wrote this rather great book\ncalled Sarvadarshansamgraha, which discussed all the religious schools of\nthought within the Hindu structure. The first chapter is on the philosophy of\nLokayata&nbsp; \u2013 a very strong presentation of\nthe argument in favor of atheism and materialism. <b style=\"background-color: lime;\">UNQUOTE</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MADHAVACHARYA , THE FOUNDER OF THE FAKE UDIPI\nMUTT AND \u201cDVAITA VEDANTA \u201c , &nbsp;IS A FAKE\nAND BACKDATED CREATION OF JEW ROTHSCHILD.&nbsp;\n&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NOBODY IN UDIPI OR INDIA , HEARD OF\nMADHAVACHARYA TILL THE WHITE INVADER CAME TO INDIA.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">THE REAL DVAITA VEDANTA OF HINDUISM IS BELOW-</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/05/dvaita-vedanta-of-sanatana-dharma-or.html\" style=\"background-color: yellow;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/05/dvaita-vedanta-of-sanatana-dharma-or.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: lime;\">QUOTE:&nbsp;\n</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Awards and honours[edit]<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\">Sen has received over </span><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>90 honorary degrees</b> </span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\">from universities around the world.</span></span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\">[40]<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Adam Smith Prize, 1954<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Foreign Honorary Member of the American\nAcademy of Arts and Sciences, 1981[41]<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Honorary fellowship by the Institute of\nSocial Studies, 1984<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Top 100 thinkers who have defined our century\nby The New Republic, 2014<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: lime;\">UNQUOTE</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WE THE PEOPLE OF INDIA DO NOT WANT PEOPLE\nLIKE AMARTYA SEN TO SAVE INDIA.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-XA0ofQ_qlig/VuPvUKOU7aI/AAAAAAABF_w/wc4Bd2DxfcABw905Wr5z75zZB7eNYRWaw/s1600/5HH8437514.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-XA0ofQ_qlig/VuPvUKOU7aI/AAAAAAABF_w/wc4Bd2DxfcABw905Wr5z75zZB7eNYRWaw/s400/5HH8437514.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Better to be united in truth, &nbsp;Than to be united in error.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">It is better to tell the truth that hurts -\nthen heals, Than to tell a lie that heals then kills.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">It is better to be hated for telling the\ntruth, &nbsp;Than to be loved for telling a\nlie.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">It is better to ultimately win with the\ntruth, &nbsp;Than to temporarily succeed with\na lie.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">- </span><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">US\nState Senator Edwin Gochenour (1953 1999)</span><o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-i-9GTZVRn8M/VuPH1mlmXUI/AAAAAAABF-g/cB765j95bEEc1kzzYUJ_TmAd0CdlqxA0A/s1600/CorrBupt-Judges.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"438\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-i-9GTZVRn8M/VuPH1mlmXUI/AAAAAAABF-g/cB765j95bEEc1kzzYUJ_TmAd0CdlqxA0A/s640/CorrBupt-Judges.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">I suggest we must have a \u201cNational Ombudsman\u201d\nwho&nbsp; deals with complaints against\nimproper conduct of Judges and living beyond their month end salaries&nbsp; . <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-D69UYx4RI0A/VuPILX5AqGI/AAAAAAABF-k/r4IQ7-2yw5cMPhJZw1iy1tS5OfdehodCg/s1600/imCVages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"398\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-D69UYx4RI0A/VuPILX5AqGI/AAAAAAABF-k/r4IQ7-2yw5cMPhJZw1iy1tS5OfdehodCg/s400/imCVages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;Lawyers and Judicial clerks are asked to be\nwhistleblowers.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The supervision MUST be by an outsider, so\nthat there can be no accusation of Judges 'protecting their own'.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This <b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">NATIONAL&nbsp;\nJUDICIAL OMBUDSMAN&nbsp;</b> must be\ncompetent.&nbsp; He must pass an exam set up by\nsenior judges supervised by CJI.&nbsp;\nJudiciary cannot accuse him&nbsp; not\nbeing an expert on proper judicial procedure.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">An ombudsman is a person who acts as a\ntrusted intermediary between either the state, elements of state or an\norganization, and some internal or external constituency, while representing\nnot only but mostly the broad scope of constituent interests. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Ombudsman is etymologically rooted in the Old\nNorse word umbo\u00f0sma\u00f0r, essentially meaning \u201crepresentative\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Ombudsman cannot interfere with the\nindependence of Judiciary in making decisions because they do not have power to\noverturn or alter court decisions.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\nThey review only procedural matters, and have no power to review the\ncontent of judicial decisions. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Regarding the behaviour of Judges, the\nOmbudsman mainly issues only reprimands or criticisms. They can also prosecute\nfor serious misbehaviour. .&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">He CAN inspect the Courts, and if he finds\nthat the Judge has committed an unquestionable error or negligence in\nperformance of his functions, he may issue a critical warning or even initiate\nprocess in Court against the Judge for abuse of power. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Even so, he does not interfere in judicial\nprocesses pending in a Court, nor does it intervene in cases in which regular\nappeal channels remain open.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Ombudsman may act on its own initiative. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Nothing prevents him from investigating why\nno Court order has yet been issued when the stipulated time there for has\nexpired, or looking into the causes of delay like lack of material means, or\noverload of cases, or functional responsibility of its head, or other\nofficials, and making recommendations for correcting the situation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The&nbsp;\nOmbudsman MUST investigate into lawyers' misconduct, and even the\nmisconduct of State Bar Council, and recommend to State Bar Council, or to the\nBar Council of India, as the case may be, for appropriate action in\ndisciplinary jurisdiction.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Ombudsman MUST be given constitutional\nstatus in the name of DEFENDER OF THE WATAN.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">NATIONAL&nbsp;\nJUDICIAL OMBUDSMAN&nbsp; MUST HAVE THE\nPOWERS TO VETO MATTERS WHERE THE WATANs SECURITY IS INVOLVED.</b><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-b7YOtsNcbBY/VuPd4dfdEVI/AAAAAAABF_c/1Kgob-lf-nk7FT6nWpIkWAeneLslBLXMQ/s1600/wc-judges-are-hurrman.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In a bid\nto ensure that the members of the higher judicature remained independent to fearlessly\nguard the rights and liberties of the poor, the framers enacted such a\nprocedure for the removal of judges of higher judiciary that\u2014characteristic of\nthe Nehru era where the noblest intentions often led to horrendous results\u2014the\nprocedure itself epitomised the circumvention of those rights and liberties it\nwas supposed to protect.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A literal lifelong immunity to the judges of higher\njudiciary was guaranteed by way of the aforesaid Constitutional provisions. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; border: 0px; font-family: roboto, sans-serif; font-stretch: inherit; line-height: 10px; margin: -5px 0px 0px; padding: 0px; position: static; vertical-align: baseline;\"><h1 class=\"heading1\" data-articletitle=\"\" style=\"border-image-outset: initial; border-image-repeat: initial; border-image-slice: initial; border-image-source: initial; border-image-width: initial; border: 0px; font-stretch: normal; font-weight: normal; line-height: 44px; margin: 0px 0px 20px; padding: 0px; vertical-align: baseline;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\">\nLok Sabha clears judicial accountability bill</span></h1>\n<div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\nTNN | Mar 30, 2012, 02.11 AM<o:p></o:p></div>\n</div>\n</section><span style=\"color: red;\"><span class=\"googlead\" style=\"background-color: white; border: 0px; color: black; display: block; font-family: &quot;roboto&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: 10px; font-stretch: inherit; line-height: 10px; margin: 10px 0px; padding: 0px; vertical-align: baseline;\"><br /></span></span><br />\n<div class=\"article_content clearfix\" style=\"background-color: white; border: 0px; color: #333333; font-family: proxima-regular1, roboto, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; font-stretch: normal; line-height: 27px; margin: 0px 0px 15px; padding: 0px; position: relative; vertical-align: baseline;\">\n<div class=\"section1\" style=\"border: 0px; font-family: inherit; font-size: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-style: inherit; font-variant: inherit; font-weight: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; vertical-align: baseline;\">\n<div class=\"Normal\" style=\"border: 0px; font-family: inherit; font-size: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-style: inherit; font-variant: inherit; font-weight: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; vertical-align: baseline;\">\n<div style=\"border: 0px; font-family: inherit; font-size: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-style: inherit; font-variant: inherit; font-weight: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; vertical-align: baseline;\">\nNEW DELHI: The Lok Sabha on Thursday cleared the judicial accountability legislation that seeks to set up a credible mechanism to probe complaints of misbehaviour by judges.<br />\n<br style=\"content: &quot;.&quot;; display: block;\" />\nThe Judicial Standards and Accountability Bill, 2010, and Constitutional 114th Amendment Bill, 2010, will help setting new probity standards in higher judiciary.</div>\n<div class=\"last8brdiv\" style=\"border: 0px; display: inline; font-family: inherit; font-size: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-style: inherit; font-variant: inherit; font-weight: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; width: auto;\">\n<div class=\"sponsor_block clearfix\" style=\"border: 0px; font-family: inherit; font-size: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-style: inherit; font-variant: inherit; font-weight: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; vertical-align: baseline;\">\n<ul class=\"colombia\" data-ad-size=\"[0,370]\" data-autoplay=\"true\" data-callback=\"sponsorAdSuccess\" data-cb=\"processCtnAds\" data-desc-len=\"90\" data-expansion-size=\"[0,380]\" data-loop=\"0\" data-native-tmpl=\"ctn_midarticle\" data-native-vid-tmpl=\"ctn_rhs_vid\" data-position=\"124620571\" data-skew=\"0\" data-slot=\"129146\" id=\"129146-124620571\" style=\"border: 0px; font-family: inherit; font-size: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-style: inherit; font-variant: inherit; font-weight: inherit; line-height: inherit; list-style: none; margin: 0px; max-height: 430px !important; overflow: hidden; padding: 0px; vertical-align: baseline;\"></ul>\n</div>\n</div>\n<br style=\"content: &quot;.&quot;; display: block;\" />\nThe bill seeks to establish credible and expedient mechanism for probing into individual complaints for misbehaviour or incapacity of a judge of the Supreme Court or of a High Court.<br />\n<div class=\"last7brdiv\" style=\"border: 0px; font-family: inherit; font-size: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-style: inherit; font-variant: inherit; font-weight: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; vertical-align: baseline;\">\n</div>\n<br style=\"content: &quot;.&quot;; display: block;\" />\n<div class=\"last6brdiv\" style=\"border: 0px; font-family: inherit; font-size: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-style: inherit; font-variant: inherit; font-weight: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; vertical-align: baseline;\">\n</div>\n<br style=\"content: &quot;.&quot;; display: block;\" />\nIt also provides to regulate the procedure for such investigation and for the presentation of an address by Parliament to President proceeding for removal of a judge and for matters connected with such matters.<br />\n<div class=\"last5brdiv\" style=\"border: 0px; display: inline; font-family: inherit; font-size: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-style: inherit; font-variant: inherit; font-weight: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; width: auto;\">\n</div>\n<br style=\"content: &quot;.&quot;; display: block;\" />\n<div class=\"last4brdiv\" style=\"border: 0px; display: inline; font-family: inherit; font-size: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-style: inherit; font-variant: inherit; font-weight: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; vertical-align: baseline; width: auto;\">\n</div>\n<br style=\"content: &quot;.&quot;; display: block;\" />\nThe bill was introduced in the Lok Sabha in 2010 and subsequently sent to the parliamentary standing committee on personnel, law and justice, which made a crucial recommendation that seeks to \"restrain\" judges from making \"unwarranted comments\" against other constitutional bodies or persons.<br />\n<div class=\"last3brdiv\" style=\"border: 0px; font-family: inherit; font-size: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-style: inherit; font-variant: inherit; font-weight: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; vertical-align: baseline;\">\n</div>\n<br style=\"content: &quot;.&quot;; display: block;\" />\n<div class=\"last2brdiv\" style=\"border: 0px; font-family: inherit; font-size: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-style: inherit; font-variant: inherit; font-weight: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; vertical-align: baseline;\">\n</div>\n<br style=\"content: &quot;.&quot;; display: block;\" />\nAccording to the bill, any judge, who makes oral comments against other constitutional authorities and individuals, would render h/himself liable for judicial misconduct.<br />\n<div class=\"last1brdiv\" style=\"border: 0px; font-family: inherit; font-size: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-style: inherit; font-variant: inherit; font-weight: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; vertical-align: baseline;\">\n</div>\n<br style=\"content: &quot;.&quot;; display: block;\" />\n<br style=\"content: &quot;.&quot;; display: block;\" />\nMaking a brief reply on the bill, law minister Salman Khurshid said the legislation seeks to set up a mechanism to inquire into complaints against a judge of the SC or the HC. The minister said the bill aims at striking a balance between maximizing judicial independence and laying down accountability for members of the higher judiciary. Khurshid said, \"The passage of this bill shall be a major achievement in establishing systems and procedures which will be far superior and practicable to that provided for in the Judges Enquiry Act.\"</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-fQBtfKKJdek/VuQWIORWcaI/AAAAAAABGAI/s_l5NIeHhhI80xvum-wLllCQVpBTxGnmg/s1600/thequint-20ff15-10-b41a6c08-bc64-433f-ad6a-71468fe3201b-iStock_000016317257_Double.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"426\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-fQBtfKKJdek/VuQWIORWcaI/AAAAAAABGAI/s_l5NIeHhhI80xvum-wLllCQVpBTxGnmg/s640/thequint-20ff15-10-b41a6c08-bc64-433f-ad6a-71468fe3201b-iStock_000016317257_Double.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<table cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"background-color: white; border: 0px; color: #474747; font-family: Georgia; font-size: 12px; overflow: scroll; width: 100%px;\"><tbody>\n<tr align=\"left\" valign=\"top\"><td class=\"leb3big\" style=\"border: 0px; font-size: 14px; font-weight: bold; padding: 0px; vertical-align: top;\"><a class=\"nodecoration leb3big\" href=\"http://www.prsindia.org/billtrack/the-judicial-standards-and-accountability-bill-2010-1399/\" style=\"color: #474747; text-decoration: none;\" title=\"Judicial,Standards,Accountability,Bill, 2010,Minister,Law,Justice,Veerappa Moily,Jayanthi,Natarajan,Judicial,Accountability,assets,judges,judicialstandards,judicial,ethics,Soumitra,Sen,Dinakaran,Judges,Enquiry,Bill,corruption\"></a><br />\n<h1 style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 10px 0px;\">\n<a class=\"nodecoration leb3big\" href=\"http://www.prsindia.org/billtrack/the-judicial-standards-and-accountability-bill-2010-1399/\" style=\"color: #474747; text-decoration: none;\" title=\"Judicial,Standards,Accountability,Bill, 2010,Minister,Law,Justice,Veerappa Moily,Jayanthi,Natarajan,Judicial,Accountability,assets,judges,judicialstandards,judicial,ethics,Soumitra,Sen,Dinakaran,Judges,Enquiry,Bill,corruption\">\nThe Judicial Standards and Accountability Bill, 2010</a></h1>\n<a class=\"nodecoration leb3big\" href=\"http://www.prsindia.org/billtrack/the-judicial-standards-and-accountability-bill-2010-1399/\" style=\"color: #474747; text-decoration: none;\" title=\"Judicial,Standards,Accountability,Bill, 2010,Minister,Law,Justice,Veerappa Moily,Jayanthi,Natarajan,Judicial,Accountability,assets,judges,judicialstandards,judicial,ethics,Soumitra,Sen,Dinakaran,Judges,Enquiry,Bill,corruption\">\n</a></td></tr>\n<tr align=\"left\" valign=\"top\"><td class=\"text1\" style=\"border: 0px; line-height: 1.5em; padding: 0px; vertical-align: top;\">The Judicial Standards and Accountability Bill tries to lay down enforceable standards of conduct for judges.&nbsp; It also requires judges to declare details of their and their family members' assets and liabilities.&nbsp; Importantly, it creates mechanisms to allow any person to complain against judges on grounds of misbehaviour or incapacity.<br />\n<h4 style=\"color: #0066cc; font-size: 16px; margin: 0px; padding-left: 5px;\">\n</h4>\n<h4 style=\"color: #0066cc; font-size: 16px; margin: 0px; padding-left: 5px;\">\n<strong>Highlights of the Bill</strong></h4>\n<ul>\n<li>The Judicial Standards and Accountability Bill, 2010 requires judges to declare their assets, lays down judicial standards, and establishes processes for removal of judges of the Supreme Court and High Courts.&nbsp;</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Judges will be required to declare their assets and liabilities, and also that of their spouse and children.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>The Bill establishes the National Judicial Oversight Committee, the Complaints Scrutiny Panel and an investigation committee.&nbsp; Any person can make a complaint against a judge to the Oversight Committee on grounds of \u2018misbehaviour\u2019.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>A motion for removal of a judge on grounds of misbehaviour can also be moved in Parliament.&nbsp; Such a motion will be referred for further inquiry to the Oversight Committee.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>Complaints and inquiries against judges will be confidential and frivolous complaints will be penalised.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>The Oversight Committee may issue advisories or warnings to judges, and also recommend their removal to the President.</li>\n</ul>\n<h4 style=\"color: #0066cc; font-size: 16px; margin: 0px; padding-left: 5px;\">\nKey Issues and Analysis</h4>\n<ul>\n<li>The key issue is whether the balance between independence and accountability is maintained by the proposed mechanism in the Bill.&nbsp; The Oversight Committee has non-judicial members which might impinge on the independence of the judiciary.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>The Bill penalises anyone who breaches the confidentiality of complaints.&nbsp; It is questionable whether a penalty is needed for a frivolous complaint that remains confidential.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>The Scrutiny Panel has judges from the same High Court.&nbsp; This is different from the in-house procedure of the Supreme Court.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>The Oversight Committee has non-judicial members.&nbsp; The procedure of the Committee is not an in-house procedure of the judiciary.&nbsp; It is not clear whether the power of the Oversight Committee to impose minor measures is constitutionally valid.</li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li>The Bill does not mention whether a judge has the right to appeal to the Supreme Court against an order of removal issued by the President after Parliament finds him guilty of \u2018misbehaviour\u2019.&nbsp;</li>\n</ul>\n</td></tr>\n</tbody></table>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-8Q0N-kMowQ8/VuQXqdaK74I/AAAAAAABGAY/l69xr261qecRyKzDMe1cfK3OxweYHj8NQ/s1600/Kennedy-anddwd-quote-CBlick-to-enlarge.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"396\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-8Q0N-kMowQ8/VuQXqdaK74I/AAAAAAABGAY/l69xr261qecRyKzDMe1cfK3OxweYHj8NQ/s640/Kennedy-anddwd-quote-CBlick-to-enlarge.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Everybody in India knew\nthat the cabal of Supreme Court judges who sat on deciding the\nconstitutionality of the National Judicial Appointments Commission (NJAC) would\nstrike this singular instrument of making the higher judiciary accountable to\nthe public as unconstitutional.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The COLLEGIUM system is a brainchild of\nBilderberg club , to control India\u2019s judiciary from abroad-like in Pakistan<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/-2IPDMHbj6w/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/-2IPDMHbj6w?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; <o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; <o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The National Judicial\nAppointments Commission Bill, introduced in Parliament on August 11, 2014 in\nconjunction with the Constitutional (Amendment) Bill, was the result of rare\nbipartisanship\u2014of the likes never seen in India for a very long time. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Parliament agreed that\njudges couldn\u2019t appoint themselves because the Collegium System had become\ndisreputable and <span style=\"color: red;\">CONTROLLED FROM ABROAD</span>, adversely affecting the principle of\nindependence of the judiciary.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; There are witnesses to this. &nbsp; &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chandraswami was the\nspiritual guru of Narasimha Rao. </span><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; Chandraswamy&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\">telephoned Narasimha Rao and several high ranked congressmen from Hotel\nSindoori \u2013 not for minutes\u2014but for hours after the bomb blast. When Chandrasekhar and Narasimha Rao were PM, Chandraswamy could walk into PMO any time, without entering his name in any register (</span><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"> I AM JUST TELLING 0.05%</b><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\"> ).</span></span></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"406\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Ivkl2xYO-gM/VuQdmyt17-I/AAAAAAABGAs/peWaxHfm1ZYoTTilZAI9VANB6LZHofEGQ/s640/colladdge_650_112414081242.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1998, the Supreme\nCourt under pressure did attempt to broad-base the Collegium System by adding\ntwo more judges to the original body of three, but its insular SINISTER character\nendured.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Over the years,\nParliament had shirked its responsibility to hold the judiciary accountable\nthanks to the MPs in Rothschild\u2019s payroll.&nbsp;\nIn 2010, the UPA showed some BALLS &nbsp;by formulating two bills, the Judicial\nAppointments Commission Bill and the Judges Standard and Accountability Bill. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;
