line-height: 19.5pt; mso-outline-level: 2;\">\n<span style=\"color: #6b6b6b; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 15.0pt;\">The bench said the\n'legitimate' objective of advertisements can always be achieved without\npublishing pictures of individuals.</span><span style=\"font-family: inherit , serif; font-size: 13.5pt;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"border: 1pt none; font-family: &quot;verdana&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: 8.5pt; padding: 0in;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: inherit , serif; font-size: 13.5pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 18.75pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 15.0pt; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 12.0pt; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<a href=\"http://images.indianexpress.com/2015/03/supreme-court.jpg\"><span style=\"border: none 1.0pt; color: blue; font-family: &quot;inherit&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 10.5pt; padding: 0in; text-decoration: none;\"><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shapetype id=\"_x0000_t75\"\n coordsize=\"21600,21600\" o:spt=\"75\" o:preferrelative=\"t\" path=\"m@4@5l@4@11@9@11@9@5xe\"\n filled=\"f\" stroked=\"f\">\n <v:stroke joinstyle=\"miter\"/>\n <v:formulas>\n  <v:f eqn=\"if lineDrawn pixelLineWidth 0\"/>\n  <v:f eqn=\"sum @0 1 0\"/>\n  <v:f eqn=\"sum 0 0 @1\"/>\n  <v:f eqn=\"prod @2 1 2\"/>\n  <v:f eqn=\"prod @3 21600 pixelWidth\"/>\n  <v:f eqn=\"prod @3 21600 pixelHeight\"/>\n  <v:f eqn=\"sum @0 0 1\"/>\n  <v:f eqn=\"prod @6 1 2\"/>\n  <v:f eqn=\"prod @7 21600 pixelWidth\"/>\n  <v:f eqn=\"sum @8 21600 0\"/>\n  <v:f eqn=\"prod @7 21600 pixelHeight\"/>\n  <v:f eqn=\"sum @10 21600 0\"/>\n </v:formulas>\n <v:path o:extrusionok=\"f\" gradientshapeok=\"t\" o:connecttype=\"rect\"/>\n <o:lock v:ext=\"edit\" aspectratio=\"t\"/>\n</v:shapetype><v:shape id=\"Picture_x0020_1\" o:spid=\"_x0000_i1025\" type=\"#_x0000_t75\"\n alt=\"Description: Supreme Court, government ads, govt ads, SC govt ads, SC government ads, PM photo, President photo, SC news, india news\"\n href=\"http://images.indianexpress.com/2015/03/supreme-court.jpg\" style='width:569.25pt;\n height:316.5pt;visibility:visible;mso-wrap-style:square' o:button=\"t\">\n <v:fill o:detectmouseclick=\"t\"/>\n <v:imagedata src=\"file:///C:\\Users\\win7\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\msohtmlclip1\\01\\clip_image001.jpg\"\n  o:title=\"Supreme Court, government ads, govt ads, SC govt ads, SC government ads, PM photo, President photo, SC news, india news\"/>\n</v:shape><![endif]--><!--[if !vml]--><!--[endif]--></span></a><span style=\"border: none 1.0pt; color: #747474; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , &quot;sans-serif&quot;; font-size: 10.5pt; padding: 0in;\">Supreme Court said several advertisements by different departments\non the same occasion were not justified.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 13.5pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 21.0pt; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 21.0pt; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: #3e3e3e; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Calling it an\n\u201cantithesis to democracy\u201d to let political functionaries develop \u201cpersonality\ncult\u201d at the cost of public money, the<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b> Supreme Court Wednesday ruled that\nphotographs of only the President, Prime Minister and Chief Justice of India\ncan be published in newspapers and other media, including the Internet.</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 21.0pt; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: #3e3e3e; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 21.0pt; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: #3e3e3e; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Prohibiting publication\nof photographs of even Governors and Chief Ministers using the public\nexchequer, a bench of Justices Ranjan Gogoi and P C Ghose said \u201cinstitutions\nneed not be glorified but they must earn glory by contribution and work\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 21.0pt; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 21.0pt; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: #3e3e3e; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">The bench noted that\npublication of photographs of a state or a political party functionary had a\ntendency to associate individuals with social benefit schemes or achievements.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 21.0pt; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 21.0pt; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: #3e3e3e; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u201cPhotographs,\ntherefore, have the potential of developing the personality cult and the image\nof one or a few individuals which is a direct antithesis of democratic\nfunctioning,\u201d it said.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 21.0pt; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 21.0pt; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: #3e3e3e; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">The bench said the\n\u201clegitimate\u201d objective of advertisements can always be achieved without publishing\npictures of individuals.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 21.0pt; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 21.0pt; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: #3e3e3e; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Citing the relevance\nof the Directive Principles of State Policy, the bench said \u201censuring avoidance\nof unproductive expenditure of public funds\u201d will go a long way in securing\n\u201csocial and economic justice to the teeming millions of the country, who even\ntoday live behind an artificially drawn poverty line.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 21.0pt; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 21.0pt; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: #3e3e3e; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">The bench said it was\nthe government\u2019s \u201cresponsibility\u201d to disseminate information necessary for the\npublic to know about policies and programmes while making certain that the\nadvertisement campaigns are objective and fair, cost-effective and definitely\n\u201cnot directed&nbsp; at promoting political interests of a party\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 21.0pt; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 21.0pt; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: #3e3e3e; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Dismissing the\nCentre\u2019s objection to restrict publication of photographs or to issue other\nguidelines, the court said it was a fit case to exercise the top court\u2019s powers\nunder Article 142 of the Constitution and impose curbs on \u201cpolitically\nmotivated\u201d advertisements.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 21.0pt; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 21.0pt; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: #3e3e3e; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">It said while the\ngovernment could issue advertisements in the memory of national leaders and\ngreat personalities,&nbsp; several advertisements by different departments on\nthe same occasion were not justified.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 21.0pt; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: #3e3e3e; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 21.0pt; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: #3e3e3e; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">A single advertisement\nissued by a central agency such as the Directorate of Advertising and Visual\nPublicity (DAVP) and information departments of states would be enough, the\nbench said.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 21.0pt; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 21.0pt; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: #3e3e3e; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">It said patronisation\nof media houses by central and state governments must be avoided and award of\nadvertisements should be on a fair and objective basis while taking note of\ncirculation etc.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 21.0pt; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 21.0pt; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: #3e3e3e; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">To iron out issues\nregarding implementation of its directions and compliance, the court said the\nCentre will constitute a three-member body of ombudsmen, comprising persons\nwith unimpeachable impartiality who have excelled in their fields.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 21.0pt; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 21.0pt; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: #3e3e3e; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">The bench, however,\nsaid there was no necessity of imposing a special curb on government\nadvertisements on the eve of the elections or to order a special audit in view\nof the guidelines issued.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 21.0pt; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 21.0pt;\">\n<span style=\"color: #3e3e3e; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Hearing PILs by NGOs Common Cause and CPIL, the court, in April\nlast year, had ordered constitution of a panel to frame comprehensive\nguidelines to help end the abuse of public advertisements for political\nmileage.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 21.0pt;\">\n<span style=\"color: #3e3e3e; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"color: #3e3e3e; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan; line-height: 28px;\"><b>http://indianexpress.com/article/india/only-photos-of-pm-president-chief-justice-to-be-allowed-in-government-advertisements-rules-supreme-court/</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: #3e3e3e; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan; line-height: 28px;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 21.0pt;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-XDrVt8lIXQI/VuFEHBC3AMI/AAAAAAABF3Q/B3USwQXsKko/s1600/4444442qb56xt.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"340\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-XDrVt8lIXQI/VuFEHBC3AMI/AAAAAAABF3Q/B3USwQXsKko/s640/4444442qb56xt.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 250%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">Time for my revelations to jump to 16.05%<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; ?</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>WRONG !</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-axPL4CtNdQc/VuFIYFg2_VI/AAAAAAABF4Q/lpKTmJnrRqg/s1600/SupremddeCourtJewGayMeme1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"436\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-axPL4CtNdQc/VuFIYFg2_VI/AAAAAAABF4Q/lpKTmJnrRqg/s640/SupremddeCourtJewGayMeme1.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">National green tribunal\n(NGT ) has &nbsp;power to initiate proceedings\nfor contempt of court, at par with a High Court which is reflected from Section\n26 of the act .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201c Even otherwise the\nNGT Act itself confers enormous power on the Tribunal to deal with any\nperson&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; who fails to comply with the\norder or award either by punishing with imprisonment up to 3 years or to&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; impose a fine up-to 10 Crores under\nSection 26 \u201c<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;S 26. Penalty for failure to comply with\norders of Tribunal (1) Whosoever, fails to comply with any order or award or\ndecision of the Tribunal under this act, he shall be punishable with\nimprisonment&nbsp; for a term which may extend\nto three years, or with fine which may extend to ten crore rupees, or with both\nand in case the failure or contravention continues, with additional fine which\nmay extend to twenty-five thousand rupees for every day during which such\nfailure or contravention continues after conviction for the first such failure\nor contravention: Provided that in case a company fails to comply with any\norder or award or a decision of the Tribunal under this Act, such company shall\nbe punishable with fine which may extend to twenty-five crore rupees, and in\ncase the failure or contravention continues, with additional fine which may\nextend to one lakh rupees for every day during which such failure or\ncontravention continues after conviction for the first such failure or\ncontravention. (2) Notwithstanding anything contained in the Code of Criminal\nProcedure, 1973 (2 of 1974), every offence under this Act shall be deemed to be\nnon-cognizable within the meaning of the said Code.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Recently ,NGT\ninitiated&nbsp; contempt of court proceedings\nas below :<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NGT charged the\ndistrict magistrate of Baghpat with contempt of court for failing to shut down\n600 brick kilns running illegally, without the mandatory environment&nbsp;&nbsp; clearances. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On September 8, 2013\nenvironmentalist Lokender Kumar had filed a petition in NGT seeking that steps\nbe taken to stem the growth of a number of illegal&nbsp;&nbsp; brick kilns in the rural belt of Baghpat.\nThe district magistrate was among the&nbsp;\nrespondents in the case.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In another instance ,\nthe NGT has issued bailable warrant against the Delhi Chief Secretary for\nfailure of officials to appear before it for apprising about the&nbsp;&nbsp; implementation of closure orders of\nstainless steel pickling firms .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">NGT is trying to acquire the powers of\nsuperior courts. \u201cNGT cannot strike down a statute. It can only examine the\ndecisions that are taken and consider if they are in compliance with the three\nprinciples laid down in Section 20 of the Act\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">NGT has been accused of overstepping its\njurisdiction and taking actions for which it has not been empowered under the\nNGT Act. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Three issues have frequently cropped up. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">First, does NGT have powers to take\ncognisance of a matter on its own and take action upon it-the power of\nsuomotu.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Second, can NGT review and direct change in\nrules and regulations-the power of judicial review. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Third, can NGT take up any case which can be\ntermed as \u201csubstantial question of environment\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Once the NGT started operating, lower courts\nwere barred from taking up environmental cases. Not that they were doing a\ngreat job, but the debarring of lower courts has meant that poor and\ndisadvantaged communities living in remote parts of the country now have to go\nto NGT Benches in their respective zones to get justice.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">For a tribal trying to\nstop pollution from an iron ore mine in Bastar, this means filing and fighting\na case in Bhopal. For a villager affected by oil pollution in Nagaland, this\nmeans coming to Kolkata and hoping to be heard quickly. This is neither easy\nnor affordable.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">NGT gave permission for TRIPLE SRIs &nbsp;three-day cultural extravaganza of Art of\nLiving on the flood plains of Yamuna river from Friday but imposed a fine of Rs\nfive crores on it as environmental compensation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">MELORDS of NGT also slapped fine of Rs five\nlakh on DDA and Rs one lakh on Delhi Pollution Control Committee (DPCC) for not\ndischarging statutory functions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">WE WILL NOT ALLOW NGT TO BE HIJACKED BY\nFOREIGN FUNDED TROJAN HORSE NGOs--</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">-- WHO DECIDE WHAT MUST BE SHUT DOWN AND WHAT\nMUST BE FINED IN AN ARBITRARY MANNER.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>BOTTOMLINE:&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">THIS BLOGSITE SUPPORTS THE NGT AND ITS SINCERE PURPOSE OF SAVING THE\nWATAN FROM DESH DROHIS AND &nbsp;POWERFUL ROGUES\n&nbsp;.</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Some\nof the roadblocks to CNG implementation could have been avoided, or at least\nminimized, had&nbsp; the conversion been\noriginally mandated through the normal legislative process. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The\nhidden dangers to human health and future of India ( babies ) could have been\nexamined.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/10/interstitial-lung-disease-nano-carbon.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/10/interstitial-lung-disease-nano-carbon.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; font-size: x-large;\">0.36% </span><span style=\"font-size: large;\">OF THE TOTAL .</span></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; line-height: 115%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/09/modern-economics-empirical-vulgar_2219.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/09/modern-economics-empirical-vulgar_2219.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Article 13(2) of the\nConstitution of India prescribes that the Union or the States shall not make\nany law that takes away or abridges any of the fundamental rights, and any law\nmade in contravention of the aforementioned mandate shall, to the extent of the\ncontravention, be void.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While judicial review\nover administrative action has evolved on the lines of common law doctrines\nsuch as \u2018proportionality\u2019, \u2018legitimate expectation\u2019, \u2018reasonableness\u2019 and\nprinciples of natural justice, the Supreme Court of India and the various High\nCourts were given the power to rule on the constitutionality of legislative as\nwell as administrative actions.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In most cases, the power of judicial review is\nexercised to protect and enforce the fundamental rights guaranteed in Part III\nof the Constitution.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hence the scope of\njudicial review before Indian courts has evolved in three dimensions \u2013<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1) Firstly, to ensure\nfairness in administrative action<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2) Secondly, to protect\nthe constitutionally guaranteed fundamental rights of citizens and thirdly to\nrule on questions of legislative competence between the centre and the states.\nThe power of the Supreme Court of India to enforce these fundamental rights is\nderived from Article 32 of the Constitution. It gives citizens the right to\ndirectly approach the Supreme Court for seeking remedies against the violation\nof these fundamental rights.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This entitlement to\nconstitutional remedies is itself a fundamental right and can be enforced in\nthe form of writs evolved in common law:-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1) habeas corpus (to\ndirect the release of a person detained unlawfully),<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">Below: &nbsp;MeLords- whether your foreign Bilderberger masters allow it or not-- &nbsp;WE THE PEOPLE shall crush the heads of Black Mamba snakes sent in by foreign desh drohis to kill Bharatmata ! &nbsp; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rothschild historians\nlove to say that it was Aristotle who for the first time classified the\nfunctions of &nbsp;the Government <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Greeko Aristotle just\nlifted from contemporary Chanakya . &nbsp;Aristotle\nwas the disciple of Plato who studied in India.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/08/chanakya-taxila-university-professor.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/08/chanakya-taxila-university-professor.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Charles-Louis de\nSecondat, Baron de La Br\u00e8de et de Montesquieu explained the doctrine :-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"<i>There is no liberty if\nthe judicial power is not separated from the legislative and executive powers.\nWhere it joined with the legislative power, the life and liberty of the subject\nwould be exposed to arbitrary control; for the Judge would then be the\nlegislator. Where it joined with the executive power, the Judge might behave\nwith violence and oppression. There would be an end of everything were the same\nman or the same body to exercise these three powers</i>\u2026\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This blogsite declares\nfor the first time on this planet.&nbsp; JEW\nRothschild used Montesquieu to foment his French Revolution.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Honor\u00e9 Gabriel Riqueti,\ncomte de Mirabeau&nbsp; , the leading orator\namong the revolutionists of this early phase, was the disciple of Montesquieu\nin his demand for a constitutional monarchy<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/11/the-french-revolution-conceived-and.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/11/the-french-revolution-conceived-and.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The doctrine of\nseparation of powers has no place in strict sense in Indian Constitution, but\nthe functions of different organs of the Government have been sufficiently\ndifferentiated, so that one organ of the Government could not usurp the\nfunction of another.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Indian Constitution\nthere is express provision that \u201cExecutive power of the Union shall be vested\nin the President and the executive power of the State shall be vested in\nGovernor..\u201d (Article 154(1) of Indian Constitution). But there is no express\nprovision that legislative and judicial powers shall be vested in any person or\norgan.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#################################################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">[Article 154]\n[Constitution]<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Central Government Act<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Article 154(1) in The\nConstitution Of India 1949<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoListParagraph\" style=\"line-height: 150%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; text-indent: -.25in;\">\n<!--[if !supportLists]--><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(1)<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;; font-size: 7pt; font-stretch: normal; line-height: normal;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;\n</span></span><!--[endif]--><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The executive power of the State shall\nbe vested in the Governor and shall be exercised by him either directly or\nthrough officers subordinate to him in accordance with this Constitution<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin-left: .25in;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">###########################################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WE THE PEOPLE OF INDIA\nWANT THE GOVERNORs POST TO BE ABOLISHED.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE GOVERNOR OF\nMAHARASHTRA ALLOWED &nbsp;A MURDERER ( PARSI &nbsp;COMMANDER NANAVATI ) TO ESCAPE .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/01/abolish-rajya-sabha-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/01/abolish-rajya-sabha-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/11/altamas-kabir-worst-chief-justice-of.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/11/altamas-kabir-worst-chief-justice-of.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">President being the\nexecutive head is also empowered to exercise legislative powers.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In his\nlegislative capacity he may promulgate Ordinances in order to meet the\nsituation as Article 123(1) says \u201cIf at any time, except when both Houses of\nParliament are in Session, President is satisfied that circumstances exist\nwhich render it necessary for him to take immediate action, he may promulgate\nsuch Ordinance as the circumstances appear to him to require\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Proclamation of\nemergency has been declared by the President due to failure of Constitutional\nmachinery the President has been given legislative power under Article 357 of\nour Constitution to make any Law in order to meet the situations.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A power has\nalso been conferred on the President of India under Article 372 and 372-A to\nadapt any Law in country by making such adaptations and modifications, whether\nby way of repeal or amendment as may be necessary or expedient for the purpose\nor bringing the provisions of such Law into accord with the provisions of the\nConstitution.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The President of India\nalso exercises judicial function. Article 103(1) of the Constitution is notable\nin this connection. According to this Article \u201cIf any question arises as to\nwhether a member or either of House of Parliament has become subject to\ndisqualification mentioned in clause (1) of Article 102, the questions hall be\nreferred for the decision of the President and his decision shall be final\u201d. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Article 50 lays\nemphasis to separate judiciary from executive. But in practice we find that the\nexecutive also exercises the powers of judiciary as in appointment of judges.\n(Articles 124, 126 &amp; Article 127).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The legislative (either House of\nParliament) also exercises Judicial function in removal of President (Article\n56) in the prescribed manner. Judiciary also exercises legislative power, High\nCourt and Supreme Court are empowered to make certain rules legislative in\ncharacter. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Whenever High Court or\nthe Supreme Court finds a certain provision of law against the Constitution or\npublic policy it declares the same null and void, and then amendments may be\nincorporated in the Legal System.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Some time High Court and Supreme Court\nformulate the principles on the point where law is silent. This power is also\nlegislative in character.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Today even an FIR\nagainst a judge can only be registered after the permission of the CJI. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This had tragic\nconsequences in the provident fund scam where then- CJI &nbsp;KG Balakrishnan did not give permission to\nfile an FIR against accused judges for almost two years, by which time the\nprime accused, Ashutosh Asthana, died in mysterious circumstances. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In his confessional\nstatement, Asthana had named 36 sitting and retired judges, including those of\nthe Allahabad High Court and district courts in Uttar Pradesh, besides an apex\ncourt judge as beneficiaries in the Ghaziabad Provident Fund (PF) scam.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The fraudulent\nwithdrawals were to the tune of 48 crores of rupees from provident fund\naccounts of class III and class IX employees.&nbsp;\nIn his statement to the trial court, Asthana named several judges and\nsaid he used to illegally withdraw cash from the PF accounts on their verbal\ninstructions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On April 28, 2008\nAsthana recorded his statement before the trial court in Ghaziabad and named 36\njudges as alleged beneficiaries, but testimony was yet to be concluded. &nbsp;&nbsp;There were eleven High Court judges who are\nalleged to have taken cash or other benefits from him. They were named by\nAsthana in his statement before the court.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This immoral scam involved\n11 High Court judges, 23 district court judges besides a Supreme Court judge,\naccused as beneficiaries of the money withdrawn fraudulently from the provident\nfund accounts of Class IV employees working in Ghaiziabad district courts<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ashutosh Asthana\u2019s wife\nSushma had declared that her &nbsp;husband had\ntold her he would be killed in Dasna jail<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>And by the way ex-CJI &nbsp;KG Balakrishnan got in via the backdoor on SC\nquota\u2014while in reality he was a Christian , NOT entitled to this quota.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Justice KG Balakrishnan\ndid not meet the minimum qualifications prescribed for being selected a judge\nof the High Court.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 16pt; line-height: 250%;\"><b>As per our constitution any &nbsp;judge can be impeached.&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 16pt; line-height: 250%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 250%;\"><b style=\"background-color: lime;\">This impeachment is carried out by a vote by ELECTED\nMembers of Parliament. &nbsp;</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 250%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">COLLEGIUM JUDGES \u2013 &nbsp;HERE IS ANOTHER BOMBSHELL\nON YOUR COLLECTIVE MELORD HEADS-<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 250%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 250%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">In your case, the appointing authority is not\nthe dismissing authority\u2014so you cant save yourself\u2014though right now you are\nappointing yourselves.</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 250%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 16pt; line-height: 250%;\"><b>ACHCHE DIN for COLLEGIUM MELORDS&nbsp; have now come to an end-</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 16pt; line-height: 250%;\"><b>DATE : 11TH MARCH 2016</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 16pt; line-height: 250%;\"><b>TIME: 1528 IST</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 250%;\">.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 250%;\"><b><span style=\"font-size: large;\">The High Court/Supreme Court judges SHALL not\nescape punishment for being a TRAITOR TO THE WATAN--</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 250%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 250%;\">- or even &nbsp;misusing their office or\n\"misbehaviour\" or for corruption.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Article 124(4) of the\nConstitution proscribes against misappropriation, bribery, committing of crimes\nof the nature of \"moral turpitude,\" acts of treason and other grave\noffences. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The Constitution Review Commission has\nproposed that the prohibited acts listed under Article 124(4) ought to be\nincluded in the definition of \"misbehaviour.\"<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;WE THE PEOPLE SHALL DECIDE ON THIS MATTER WHEN\nIT COMES TO SEDITION AND&nbsp; TREASON BY\nMELORD COLLEGIUM JUDGES.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">TAKE IT EASY WHEN YOU\nPUSH FOR END OF AFSPA AND TO POKING YOUR NOSE TOO MUCH IN IB/ RAW/ NIA\nAFFAIRS.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Article 124(4) SHALL\nremain applicable to the case of the High Court and Supreme Court judges\u2014if they\nare clearly guilty of TREASON by accepting money from foreign forces to KILL Bharatmata.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">INTERLINKING OF INDIAN\nRIVERS WOULD HAVE KILLED BHARATMATA<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Supreme Court,\nwhile interpreting Articles 14 and 21 of the Constitution, has been banking\nupon the American Constitution and its interpretation in case law. For example\nIndian Constitution's \"procedure as established by law'' is approaching\ntowards the American \"process by law.\" <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By the same token it\nwould be good for Indian justice to borrow the \"process of law\" to\nwhich American judges found guilty of offences are subjected to, while facing\nconsequences of their unacceptable actions.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: x-large; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: x-large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">WE INDIANS ARE NOT\nSLAVES OF ROTHSCHILDs USA !</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">DEVIANT BEHAVIOR not\namounting to MISBEHAVIOR includes--,<span style=\"color: purple;\"> <i>indifference to natural justice, &nbsp;lack of punctuality and irregularity in\nobserving working hours; keeping away from work without applying for leave;\nreserving judgments, at times for years; jumping the cause list or manipulating\nthem for deliberately placing heavier matters at the fag-end with a view to\ndelaying disposal; adjournments for no valid reason; some judges even\nmanipulate allotment of cases; seek cheap popularity or media attention; mix\nwith politicians, thus compromising the \"image of neutrality\"\nexpected of a judge.</i></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Which\nmother/ wife/ daughter wants a man to visit CHAMIYA BARS&nbsp; ( front for whorehouses ) and ogle at cheap dancing\ngirls \u2013 where hard earned money is drained ? &nbsp; The dancing girls receive just a small percentage of this money .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Judicial activism\nimplies going beyond the normal constraints applied to jurists and the\nConstitution, which gives jurists the right to strike down any legislation or\nrule against the precedent if it goes against the Constitution.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Judicial activism is premised upon the fact\nthat judges assume a role as independent policy makers or independent\n\u201ctrustees\u201d on behalf of society that goes beyond their traditional role as\ninterpreters of the Constitution and laws. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">I TRASHED THE COMPANY RULE BOOKS.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">I WAS GOOD IN APPLYING BODMAS.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br />https://www.google.co.in/webhp?source=search_app&amp;gfe_rd=cr&amp;ei=xD85U8vKLqrW8gf3koDYCA#q=merchant+shipping+act+</span></span></b><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Judicial activism in\nIndia means the power of the Supreme Court and the high courts (but not the\nsub-ordinate courts ) to declare the laws as unconstitutional and void if it\ninfringes or if the law is inconsistent with one or more provisions of the\nconstitution. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To the extent of such\ninconsistency while declaring a law as constitutional and void the courts do\nnot suggest any viable alternative measures.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Supreme Court of India &nbsp;slowly started acquiring more power through\nconstitutional interpretation with help from foreign KOSHER forces.&nbsp; &nbsp;Its\ntransformation into an activist court has been gradual and imperceptible to an\naverage Indian caught up in the daily grind of life<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fali Nariman spAke:---\n\"Judges have wrapped themselves in a cloak of inviolability-- How are they\nappointed? Why are they appointed? What are their shortcomings? How are these\ndealt with? \"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ask and they will say,\n'It is none of your business to ask us questions. We know what is best for the\nsystem'.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Are judges above the\nlaw?&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Not really.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\">But they live in a politico-legal no-man's-land.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No one can\nfile a case against them without the permission of the CJI.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-aINCdt_EaqI/VuMqq4jqiMI/AAAAAAABF9Q/QEgcVKConjIJum6GBGaJXUEU_Z5dC6BwQ/s1600/iDmages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-aINCdt_EaqI/VuMqq4jqiMI/AAAAAAABF9Q/QEgcVKConjIJum6GBGaJXUEU_Z5dC6BwQ/s400/iDmages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: x-large;\"><b style=\"background-color: lime;\">Today, the Maoists and\nNaxals control 31% of India\u2019s forests.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The genesis of Salwa\nJudum lies in the refusal of a large section of tribal society to endure this\nnonsense any longer.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">What began in May 2005 in Kutru village in Dantewada and\nquickly spread to neighbouring areas was essentially a non-cooperation movement\nagainst an occupying Red Army.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Maoists and their sympathisers were chased\nout of villages and their supply chain was crippled. When large 8,000-strong\ngatherings of local people voted in unison to fight the Maoist menace, if\nnecessary with bows and arrows, Chhattisgarh saw the beginnings of a popular\nupsurge.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The local administration had neither the force nor resource to provide\nadequate protection to the Salwa Judum.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Maoists responded\nto the challenge with characteristic savagery.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On February 28 this year, 26\npeople died in a landmine explosion at the venue of a Salwa Judum rally. On\nApril 28, 13 people were abducted from Mankota village and killed in an\narticular manner.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The idea was to\nintimidate villagers into submission.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Maoist reign of terror has yielded\nresults.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The 50,000 people living in the relief camps have not been forcibly\nrelocated as Maoist pamphleteers suggest.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They were refugees who have fled their\nvillages with nothing but the clothes they were wearing.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">. They did NOT have </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">cattle and livestock\u2014ony an IDIOT would not\nnotice this ..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Maoists cannot be tamed by pouring money into inefficient\nwelfare schemes. The guerrillas want to usurp political power by force and they\nare controlled and armed by foreign forces.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>JEW Noan Chomsky was\nMAHAAAA khush !<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Salwa Judum can be a\nfitting complement to a mammoth counter-insurgency drive.&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>It needs to be\nreplicated throughout the Maoist belt.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; KNOW WHAT IS HAPPENING , MELORDS ! &nbsp;</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b>WE DO NOT TRUST THE JUDAS MAIN STREAM MEDIA ANY MORE &nbsp;!!</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><br /></b></span></span>\n\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: cyan;\"></b></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the multi-crore\nGhaziabad court provident fund scam, CJI Balakrishnan did not give permission\nto investigate for over one-and-a-half years, not even for the police to file\nan FIR.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By the time the CBI finished the probe in 2010, evidence had\ndisappeared, most judges did not bother to attend the hearings, and the prime\naccused, Ashutosh Asthana, who had named 36 judges, was found dead under\nmysterious circumstances.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SC judge Tarun Chatterjee, who was named as one of\nthe beneficiaries, had already retired.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">WE SHALL DO IT AS \"WE THE PEOPLE\" ARE ABOVE THE CONSTITUTION.</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot;
